models.name: shopping_mall_auth_tokens
models.description: JWT token storage for authentication. Stores both access tokens and refresh tokens issued during login. Access tokens are short-lived (15 minutes) for immediate API access, while refresh tokens are long-lived (30 days) for session continuation. Tokens are stored hashed (never plaintext) for security compliance. Tracks token status (active, revoked, expired) and associated session information.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to authenticated user (customer, seller, or admin). {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}

plainFields.name: token_type
plainFields.description: Type of token: 'access' for short-lived API tokens (15 min) or 'refresh' for long-lived session tokens (30 days). Determines token expiration and usage rules.

plainFields.name: token_hash
plainFields.description: Bcrypt-hashed token value for secure storage. Never store plaintext tokens. Hash generated with 12 salt rounds. Original token returned to client only at creation time.

plainFields.name: issued_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when token was issued. Used to calculate token age and enforce expiration. Immutable after creation.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when token expires and becomes invalid. Access tokens expire at issued_at + 15 minutes, refresh tokens at issued_at + 30 days.

plainFields.name: revoked_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when token was revoked (if applicable). Null if token has never been revoked. Tokens are revoked on logout or during security incidents.

plainFields.name: last_used_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when token was last used in an API request. Null if token has never been used. Updated on each token usage for tracking activity patterns.

plainFields.name: device_id
plainFields.description: Device fingerprint hash identifying the device/browser that requested the token. Used to detect token usage from unexpected devices. Generated from user agent and IP address.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which token was requested. Used for geolocation checks and detecting unusual access patterns. Supports both IPv4 and IPv6 formats.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser/device user agent string from token request. Used for device fingerprinting and detecting browser changes. Maximum 500 characters.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current token status: 'active' (valid for use), 'revoked' (invalidated), 'expired' (past expiration time). Tokens transition from active to expired at expiration timestamp.

models.name: shopping_mall_sessions
models.description: Server-side session management tracking user authentication state across requests. Each active session represents a user logged in from a specific device/browser. Stores session metadata, device information, and tracks login/activity timestamps. Implements concurrent session limits (5 for regular users, 10 for admins) by terminating oldest sessions when limit exceeded.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to authenticated user who owns this session (customer, seller, or admin). {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}

plainFields.name: session_token
plainFields.description: Cryptographically secure session identifier (minimum 32 random characters). Used to associate requests with this session. Unique globally across all sessions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when session was created (user login time). Immutable after creation. Used to calculate session age and enforce 90-day session lifetime.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of most recent request using this session. Updated on every API request. Used to detect inactive sessions and calculate idle time.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when session expires. Sessions expire 90 days after creation regardless of activity. When expired, new login required.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: Primary IP address from which session was initiated. Used for geolocation tracking and detecting impossible travel patterns. May change during mobile roaming.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser/device user agent string at session creation. Used for device fingerprinting and detecting suspicious agent changes. Maximum 500 characters.

plainFields.name: device_fingerprint
plainFields.description: Cryptographic hash of device characteristics (user agent, browser, screen resolution). Used to detect when same session is used from different devices.

plainFields.name: browser_name
plainFields.description: Parsed browser name from user agent (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, etc.). Used for security analysis and user device identification.

plainFields.name: operating_system
plainFields.description: Parsed operating system from user agent (Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, Linux). Used for device type classification.

plainFields.name: device_type
plainFields.description: Device category: 'mobile', 'tablet', 'desktop'. Determined from user agent parsing. Used for responsive experience and security classification.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Session status: 'active' (usable), 'suspended' (locked for investigation), 'expired' (past expiration time), 'terminated' (user logout). Determines whether session can be used.

models.name: shopping_mall_session_devices
models.description: Device tracking for multi-device session management. Records each unique device/browser combination a user logs in from. Used to enforce concurrent session limits (5 for users, 10 for admins), detect unauthorized devices, and improve security through device recognition. Links devices to sessions for holistic user authentication history.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to user who owns this device record. {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_session_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the session associated with this device login. {@link shopping_mall_sessions.id}

plainFields.name: device_name
plainFields.description: User-friendly device name set by user (e.g., 'My Laptop', 'iPhone 14 Pro', 'Office Desktop'). Optional custom name for easy device identification. Maximum 100 characters.

plainFields.name: device_fingerprint
plainFields.description: Cryptographic hash identifying this specific device/browser combination. Generated from user agent, resolution, plugins, timezone, and other characteristics.

plainFields.name: browser_name
plainFields.description: Browser name parsed from user agent (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge). Used for device classification and user-friendly display.

plainFields.name: browser_version
plainFields.description: Browser version number (e.g., '120.0.1234.567'). Used for security checks and deprecation warnings for outdated browsers.

plainFields.name: operating_system
plainFields.description: Operating system name (Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, Linux). Used for device classification and compatibility tracking.

plainFields.name: os_version
plainFields.description: Operating system version (e.g., 'Windows 11', 'macOS 14.1'). Used for security analysis and support decisions.

plainFields.name: device_type
plainFields.description: Device category: 'mobile', 'tablet', 'desktop'. Determines responsive behavior and interaction patterns.

plainFields.name: first_login_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of first login from this device. Used to identify new devices and track device age.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of most recent login from this device. Updated on each login from this device.

plainFields.name: login_count
plainFields.description: Total number of times user has logged in from this device. Incremented on each successful login. Used to identify frequently used devices.

plainFields.name: last_ip_address
plainFields.description: Most recent IP address used with this device. May change for mobile devices due to roaming. Used for location tracking.

plainFields.name: trust_status
plainFields.description: Device trust level: 'trusted' (recognized), 'new' (first use, may require verification), 'suspicious' (flagged for unusual behavior). Used to determine if extra verification needed.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether device is currently active. True if device has been used within last 30 days. False marks device as dormant.

models.name: shopping_mall_password_reset_tokens
models.description: Secure password reset token management for account recovery. Issues time-limited (1 hour) tokens that allow users to reset forgotten passwords. Tokens are one-time use only - invalidated after first use to prevent brute force attacks. Tracks token status, usage timestamps, and consumed status for security.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to user account requesting password reset. {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}

plainFields.name: token
plainFields.description: Cryptographically secure reset token (minimum 32 random characters). Sent to user's email. Must be provided to verify password reset request. Never displayed to user after initial generation.

plainFields.name: token_hash
plainFields.description: Bcrypt-hashed token value stored in database. Original token never stored plaintext. Hash generated with 12 salt rounds for security.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when reset token was generated. Used to calculate token age and enforce 1-hour expiration window.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when token expires and becomes unusable. Set to created_at + 1 hour. More restrictive than access tokens (1 hour vs 15 minutes) for security.

plainFields.name: used_at
plainFields.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when token was successfully used to reset password. Null if never used. Indicates token has been consumed.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which token was requested. Used for fraud detection and tracking password reset requests. May differ from IP of actual password reset.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser/device user agent string from token request. Used for device fingerprinting and detecting suspicious reset patterns.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Token status: 'pending' (waiting for use), 'used' (successfully redeemed), 'expired' (past expiration time). Tokens transition from pending to used on successful password reset.

models.name: shopping_mall_customer
models.description: Customer user accounts representing authenticated buyers on the platform. Stores core customer profile information including personal details, account status, email verification state, and security settings. Customers are the primary users who browse products, create orders, write reviews, and manage their shopping experience on the platform.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Customer's email address used for login and communication. Must be unique across all customers on the platform. Email is verified during registration before account activation.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Bcrypt-hashed password for account authentication. The plain password is never stored; only the cryptographic hash is maintained for security. Password updates create new hash.

plainFields.name: first_name
plainFields.description: Customer's first name. Used for personalization in communications and order fulfillment. Required field for all customers.

plainFields.name: last_name
plainFields.description: Customer's last name. Combined with first name for complete customer identification in orders and communications.

plainFields.name: phone_number
plainFields.description: Customer's contact phone number in international format. Optional field that enables SMS notifications and seller communication. Stored in E.164 format (e.g., +1-555-123-4567).

plainFields.name: date_of_birth
plainFields.description: Customer's date of birth for age verification and personalization. Optional field used for age-restricted products and birthday promotions.

plainFields.name: gender
plainFields.description: Customer's gender for personalization and targeted recommendations. Values: 'M', 'F', 'O' (Other), 'N' (Prefer not to say). Optional field.

plainFields.name: profile_image_url
plainFields.description: URL to customer's profile picture. Used for display in reviews, comments, and public-facing customer profiles. Optional field.

plainFields.name: account_status
plainFields.description: Current status of customer account: 'ACTIVE' (normal operation), 'SUSPENDED' (temporary restriction), 'DEACTIVATED' (account closed), 'PENDING_EMAIL_VERIFICATION' (awaiting email confirmation). Controls account access and functionality.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Flag indicating whether customer's email address has been verified. Email verification is required for account activation and must be completed within 24 hours of registration.

plainFields.name: two_factor_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether two-factor authentication (2FA) is enabled for this customer account. When enabled, login requires secondary verification (SMS code, authenticator app).

plainFields.name: two_factor_method
plainFields.description: Method used for two-factor authentication if enabled. Values: 'SMS', 'EMAIL', 'AUTHENTICATOR_APP', 'BACKUP_CODES'. Null if 2FA not enabled.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of customer's most recent successful login. Used for tracking account activity and detecting suspicious access patterns.

plainFields.name: account_locked_until
plainFields.description: Timestamp until which account is locked due to failed login attempts. Account automatically unlocks when this timestamp is reached. Null if account is not locked.

plainFields.name: failed_login_attempts
plainFields.description: Count of consecutive failed login attempts. Resets to zero on successful login. Account locks after 5 failed attempts within 15 minutes.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when customer account was created. Immutable field set at registration completion.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent account update including profile changes, status changes, or password updates.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp when customer account was permanently deleted. Null for active/suspended accounts. Enables account recovery within compliance window.

plainFields.name: account_flags
plainFields.description: Comma-separated flags for account restrictions or notes: 'FRAUD_INVESTIGATION', 'POLICY_VIOLATION', 'CHARGEBACK_HISTORY', 'MULTIPLE_RETURNS'. Used by admins for account moderation.

models.name: shopping_mall_seller
models.description: Seller merchant accounts representing businesses selling products on the platform. Stores seller business profile, verification status, commission configuration, and account settings. Sellers manage product inventory, fulfill customer orders, and operate their online stores within the marketplace ecosystem.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Seller's business email address used for login and official communications. Must be unique across all sellers. Email is verified during onboarding.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Bcrypt-hashed password for seller account authentication. Plain password never stored for security compliance.

plainFields.name: store_name
plainFields.description: Official name of seller's store as displayed to customers. Must be unique across platform. Used in product listings, orders, and customer communications.

plainFields.name: store_code
plainFields.description: Unique alphanumeric code for seller store (e.g., 'SELLER-001'). Used for internal routing and metrics. Format: seller-assigned or system-generated during registration.

plainFields.name: store_description
plainFields.description: Seller's store description visible on public store page. Up to 5000 characters describing business, policies, and seller story. Optional field.

plainFields.name: store_logo_url
plainFields.description: URL to seller's store logo displayed on store page and product listings. Optional field for branding.

plainFields.name: store_banner_url
plainFields.description: URL to seller's store banner image displayed at top of store page. Optional field for visual branding.

plainFields.name: business_type
plainFields.description: Type of business entity: 'INDIVIDUAL' (sole proprietor), 'SMALL_BUSINESS' (1-50 employees), 'MEDIUM_BUSINESS' (50-500 employees), 'ENTERPRISE' (500+ employees). Affects commission rates and feature access.

plainFields.name: business_registration_number
plainFields.description: Official business registration number (e.g., EIN, Company Registration Number). Varies by jurisdiction. Optional for individual sellers in some regions.

plainFields.name: tax_id
plainFields.description: Tax identification number (e.g., VAT ID, GST number) for tax compliance. Encrypted in database. Optional field.

plainFields.name: contact_person_name
plainFields.description: Name of primary contact person for seller account. Used for communication and verification purposes.

plainFields.name: contact_phone
plainFields.description: Business phone number in international format. Used for seller contact and verification.

plainFields.name: business_address
plainFields.description: Complete business address including street, city, state, postal code, country. Used for order fulfillment and seller identity verification.

plainFields.name: country
plainFields.description: Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) where seller business is registered. Affects tax rates, shipping capabilities, and payment processing.

plainFields.name: account_status
plainFields.description: Seller account status: 'PENDING_VERIFICATION' (awaiting approval), 'VERIFIED' (approved to sell), 'REJECTED' (application rejected), 'SUSPENDED' (temporary restriction), 'DEACTIVATED' (account closed). Only verified sellers can list and sell products.

plainFields.name: verification_status
plainFields.description: Document verification status: 'PENDING' (awaiting review), 'VERIFIED' (documents approved), 'REJECTED' (documents not acceptable), 'EXPIRED' (verification documents expired). Separate from account_status.

plainFields.name: average_rating
plainFields.description: Seller's average rating calculated from customer reviews. Range: 1.0 to 5.0. Updated when new reviews are published. Used for seller visibility and trust metrics.

plainFields.name: total_reviews
plainFields.description: Total count of approved customer reviews for this seller's products. Updated when reviews are published or removed.

plainFields.name: fulfillment_rate
plainFields.description: Percentage of orders successfully fulfilled on time (0-100). Calculated as: (on-time orders / total orders) * 100. Used for seller ranking and visibility.

plainFields.name: response_time_hours
plainFields.description: Average response time to customer inquiries in hours. Calculated from support ticket response times. Used for seller performance metrics.

plainFields.name: commission_rate
plainFields.description: Percentage commission charged on seller's sales (0-100). Default: 10%. Premium sellers or negotiated rates may differ. Updated when seller tier changes.

plainFields.name: seller_tier
plainFields.description: Seller's tier/status level: 'STANDARD' (default), 'PREMIUM' (top performer), 'ENTERPRISE' (high volume). Affects commission rates and feature access.

plainFields.name: two_factor_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether two-factor authentication is enabled for seller account.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent seller dashboard login.

plainFields.name: account_locked_until
plainFields.description: Timestamp until which seller account is locked due to failed login attempts. Null if not locked.

plainFields.name: failed_login_attempts
plainFields.description: Count of consecutive failed seller login attempts. Resets on successful login.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when seller account was created during registration.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent seller account update.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp when seller account was closed. Null for active accounts. Enables account data retention for compliance.

plainFields.name: account_flags
plainFields.description: Comma-separated admin flags: 'FRAUD_INVESTIGATION', 'POLICY_VIOLATION', 'HIGH_CHARGEBACK_RATE'. Used for account moderation.

models.name: shopping_mall_admin
models.description: Administrator accounts with platform management and moderation capabilities. Admins have elevated permissions to manage users, approve products, handle disputes, process refunds, configure settings, and access audit logs. Admin accounts track access control levels and maintain security audit trails.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Admin's email address used for login and official administrative communications. Must be unique across all admins.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Bcrypt-hashed password for admin authentication. Plain password never stored.

plainFields.name: first_name
plainFields.description: Admin's first name for identification and audit trails.

plainFields.name: last_name
plainFields.description: Admin's last name for identification in administrative records.

plainFields.name: admin_role
plainFields.description: Admin permission level: 'SUPER_ADMIN' (full platform access), 'ADMIN' (general admin functions), 'MODERATOR' (content moderation only), 'SUPPORT_ADMIN' (customer support), 'FINANCE_ADMIN' (payment management). Determines feature access.

plainFields.name: permission_level
plainFields.description: Numeric permission hierarchy (0-100): 100=Super Admin with all permissions, 75=Admin with most permissions, 50=Moderator with moderation-only permissions, 25=Support with limited access. Used for permission checks.

plainFields.name: account_status
plainFields.description: Admin account status: 'ACTIVE' (can access platform), 'INACTIVE' (cannot access), 'SUSPENDED' (temporary restriction). Controls admin access.

plainFields.name: two_factor_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether two-factor authentication is required for this admin. Mandatory for Super Admin and recommended for all admins.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of admin's most recent login.

plainFields.name: account_locked_until
plainFields.description: Timestamp until which admin account is locked due to failed login attempts. Null if not locked.

plainFields.name: failed_login_attempts
plainFields.description: Count of consecutive failed admin login attempts. Resets on successful login.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when admin account was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent admin account update.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp when admin account was deactivated. Null for active accounts. Enables audit trail preservation.

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Administrative notes about this admin account (e.g., department, responsibilities, creation reason). Optional field for documentation.

models.name: shopping_mall_guest
models.description: Guest user profiles for unauthenticated users browsing the platform. Tracks guest sessions for analytics, recommendations, and fraud detection. Guests can browse products and read reviews but cannot purchase or create accounts. Guest data enables anonymous user experience tracking and recommendations.

plainFields.name: guest_code
plainFields.description: Unique anonymous identifier for guest session. Generated format: 'GUEST-' + random string. Used to track guest activity without personal identification.

plainFields.name: session_id
plainFields.description: Reference to the guest's current session. Links to session tracking system for timeout and activity monitoring.

plainFields.name: device_fingerprint
plainFields.description: Hash of device characteristics (user agent, IP, browser) for fraud detection and session security. Can identify same device accessing platform.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address of guest user request. Used for geographic targeting and fraud detection. Stored for security audit.

plainFields.name: country
plainFields.description: Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) derived from IP or user preference. Used for product availability and recommendation localization.

plainFields.name: preferred_language
plainFields.description: Guest's language preference (ISO 639-1 code, e.g., 'en', 'fr'). Can be inferred from browser settings or explicitly set.

plainFields.name: browsing_history
plainFields.description: Comma-separated list of recently viewed product IDs for recommendation engine. Stored as denormalized data for performance. Cleared on session timeout.

plainFields.name: cart_items_count
plainFields.description: Count of items in guest's temporary shopping cart (not persisted if guest doesn't register). Used for analytics.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when guest session was initiated.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of guest's most recent activity. Used to determine session timeout.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp when guest session expired or ended. Null for active guest sessions.

models.name: shopping_mall_customer_addresses
models.description: Multiple delivery addresses associated with customers for flexible order fulfillment. Customers can save multiple addresses (home, work, family, etc.) and select delivery address during checkout. Addresses include validation status and default address tracking for convenient ordering.

foreignFields.name: shopping_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the customer who owns this address. {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}

plainFields.name: address_label
plainFields.description: User-defined label for address: 'Home', 'Work', 'Office', 'Parents', 'Vacation Home', etc. Helps customer quickly identify desired address during checkout.

plainFields.name: is_default
plainFields.description: Whether this is the customer's default delivery address. Used for quick checkout. Only one address per customer can be default.

plainFields.name: recipient_name
plainFields.description: Name of person who will receive delivery at this address. May differ from customer name for household members or business locations.

plainFields.name: recipient_phone
plainFields.description: Contact phone number for delivery. Used by shipping carriers for delivery coordination and exception handling.

plainFields.name: street_address
plainFields.description: Full street address including number and street name. Example: '123 Main Street Apt 4B' or 'PO Box 456'.

plainFields.name: city
plainFields.description: City or town name where address is located.

plainFields.name: state_province
plainFields.description: State, province, or region code. Format varies by country (e.g., 'CA' for California, 'BC' for British Columbia).

plainFields.name: postal_code
plainFields.description: Postal code in country-specific format. Examples: '90210' (USA), 'V6B 4X8' (Canada), 'SW1A 1AA' (UK). Validated against country format rules.

plainFields.name: country
plainFields.description: Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) where address is located. Determines shipping availability and tax calculations.

plainFields.name: address_type
plainFields.description: Type of address: 'RESIDENTIAL' (home address), 'BUSINESS' (office/business), 'PO_BOX' (postal box). Used for delivery method selection.

plainFields.name: delivery_instructions
plainFields.description: Special delivery instructions (e.g., 'Use back gate', 'Leave with neighbor', 'Ring twice'). Passed to shipping carrier for delivery optimization.

plainFields.name: is_verified
plainFields.description: Whether address has been verified as deliverable by shipping carriers. Unverified addresses may have delivery issues.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when customer added this address.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent address modification.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp when customer archived address. Null for active addresses. Allows removal without losing order history.

models.name: shopping_mall_seller_bank_accounts
models.description: Bank account information for seller commission payouts and fund transfers. Stores encrypted bank details for financial transactions and seller fund management. Includes verification status and preferred payment method configuration. Critical for seller payment processing and financial reconciliation.

foreignFields.name: shopping_seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the seller who owns this bank account. {@link shopping_mall_seller.id}

plainFields.name: account_holder_name
plainFields.description: Name of bank account holder. Must match bank records for account verification and compliance.

plainFields.name: bank_name
plainFields.description: Official name of the bank issuing the account. Example: 'JPMorgan Chase', 'Bank of America'.

plainFields.name: bank_code
plainFields.description: Bank's routing number (USA), SWIFT code, or country-specific bank code for wire transfers.

plainFields.name: account_number_encrypted
plainFields.description: Bank account number encrypted using application-level encryption. Never stored in plain text for PCI compliance. Encryption key stored separately.

plainFields.name: account_number_last4
plainFields.description: Last 4 digits of bank account for customer reference (e.g., '5678'). Used to display account without revealing full number.

plainFields.name: account_type
plainFields.description: Type of bank account: 'CHECKING' (standard business account), 'SAVINGS' (interest-bearing), 'MONEY_MARKET' (limited transfers). Affects transfer capabilities.

plainFields.name: currency
plainFields.description: ISO 4217 currency code for the bank account (e.g., 'USD', 'EUR', 'GBP'). Payouts are made in this currency.

plainFields.name: is_primary
plainFields.description: Whether this is the primary payout account for commissions. Only one account per seller can be primary. Fallback for disputes and reversals.

plainFields.name: verification_status
plainFields.description: Bank account verification status: 'PENDING' (awaiting verification), 'VERIFIED' (confirmed valid), 'FAILED' (rejected during verification), 'UNVERIFIED' (needs re-verification). Only verified accounts receive payouts.

plainFields.name: verification_attempts
plainFields.description: Number of verification attempts made for this bank account. Failed verification may indicate incorrect account details.

plainFields.name: verified_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when bank account was successfully verified. Null if not verified.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when seller added this bank account.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent bank account update.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp when bank account was removed. Null for active accounts. Preserves payment history.

models.name: shopping_mall_seller_verification_documents
models.description: Seller identity and business verification documents for regulatory compliance and fraud prevention. Stores document types, upload status, verification results, and rejection reasons. Enables multi-step seller onboarding with document validation and compliance tracking.

foreignFields.name: shopping_seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the seller who submitted this verification document. {@link shopping_mall_seller.id}

plainFields.name: document_type
plainFields.description: Type of verification document submitted: 'BUSINESS_LICENSE' (official business registration), 'TAX_ID_DOCUMENT' (tax identification), 'BANK_STATEMENT' (account verification), 'OWNER_ID' (identity verification), 'ARTICLES_OF_INCORPORATION' (business formation), 'PASSPORT' (personal identification), 'UTILITY_BILL' (address verification). Determines validation requirements.

plainFields.name: document_url
plainFields.description: URL to uploaded document file. Stored in secure cloud storage with access restricted to authorized personnel. Documents expire and must be re-uploaded periodically.

plainFields.name: document_name
plainFields.description: Original filename of uploaded document. Used for reference in verification process.

plainFields.name: document_issue_date
plainFields.description: Date document was issued by issuing authority. Null if not applicable. Used for expiration calculation.

plainFields.name: document_expiry_date
plainFields.description: Date document expires if applicable. Null for non-expiring documents. System alerts seller when expiry approaches.

plainFields.name: verification_status
plainFields.description: Document verification status: 'PENDING_REVIEW' (awaiting human review), 'VERIFIED' (approved as valid), 'REJECTED' (failed verification), 'EXPIRED' (document needs renewal). Controls seller account eligibility.

plainFields.name: verification_notes
plainFields.description: Admin notes from verification process. For rejected documents, explains reason for rejection (e.g., 'Document illegible', 'Expired', 'Does not match seller information'). Guides seller on corrective action.

plainFields.name: verified_by_admin_id
plainFields.description: Reference to admin who verified this document. Null if not yet verified. Used for audit trail.

plainFields.name: verified_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when document was verified or rejected. Null if still pending.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when seller uploaded this document.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent document status update.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp when document was archived. Null for active documents. Preserves verification history.

models.name: shopping_mall_user_preferences
models.description: User-configurable preferences and settings for personalized platform experience. Enables customers to customize interface language, currency display, search preferences, recommendation settings, and shopping behavior. Applies to both customers and sellers for UX personalization.

foreignFields.name: shopping_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the customer these preferences belong to. {@link shopping_mall_customer.id} Set for customer preferences, null for seller preferences.

foreignFields.name: shopping_seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the seller these preferences belong to. {@link shopping_mall_seller.id} Set for seller preferences, null for customer preferences.

plainFields.name: preferred_language
plainFields.description: ISO 639-1 language code for UI language (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr', 'de', 'zh', 'ja'). Defaults to account creation language.

plainFields.name: preferred_currency
plainFields.description: ISO 4217 currency code for price display (e.g., 'USD', 'EUR', 'GBP', 'JPY'). Can differ from account currency.

plainFields.name: timezone
plainFields.description: IANA timezone identifier (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London', 'Asia/Tokyo'). Used for time-based notifications and reports.

plainFields.name: enable_search_history
plainFields.description: Whether to save search history for personalized recommendations. Users can delete history anytime.

plainFields.name: enable_personalized_recommendations
plainFields.description: Whether to enable AI-powered product recommendations based on browsing and purchase history.

plainFields.name: enable_price_drop_alerts
plainFields.description: Whether to enable notifications when prices drop on wishlisted items.

plainFields.name: theme_preference
plainFields.description: UI theme preference: 'LIGHT' (light mode), 'DARK' (dark mode), 'AUTO' (follow system preference). Default: 'LIGHT'.

plainFields.name: product_sorting_default
plainFields.description: Default product sort order: 'RELEVANCE' (search relevance), 'PRICE_ASC' (low to high), 'PRICE_DESC' (high to low), 'NEWEST' (latest first), 'BEST_RATED' (highest rating). Default: 'RELEVANCE'.

plainFields.name: items_per_page
plainFields.description: Number of items displayed per page (20, 50, 100). Default: 50. Affects pagination.

plainFields.name: show_adult_products
plainFields.description: Whether to show age-restricted products in search results. Default: false (unless user verified as adult).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when preference record was created (usually at user registration).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent preference update.

models.name: shopping_mall_user_notification_settings
models.description: Detailed notification channel preferences and frequency controls for both customers and sellers. Enables granular control over email, SMS, in-app, and push notifications for different event types. Supports opt-in/opt-out by channel and event category with quiet hours configuration.

foreignFields.name: shopping_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the customer these notification settings belong to. {@link shopping_mall_customer.id} Set for customer notification settings, null for seller settings.

foreignFields.name: shopping_seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the seller these notification settings belong to. {@link shopping_mall_seller.id} Set for seller notification settings, null for customer settings.

plainFields.name: email_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive email notifications. Controls all email-based alerts. Default: true.

plainFields.name: sms_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive SMS text notifications. Requires verified phone number. Default: false.

plainFields.name: push_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive push notifications on mobile app. Default: true (if app installed).

plainFields.name: in_app_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive in-app notifications. These always appear regardless of other settings. Default: true.

plainFields.name: order_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive order-related notifications (confirmation, shipping, delivery). Default: true.

plainFields.name: review_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive notifications about product reviews and ratings. Default: true.

plainFields.name: promotion_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive promotional and marketing notifications (deals, new arrivals). Default: true.

plainFields.name: message_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive notifications about direct messages from sellers/customers. Default: true.

plainFields.name: payment_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to receive payment and billing notifications. Default: true.

plainFields.name: notification_frequency
plainFields.description: Frequency of non-urgent notifications: 'REAL_TIME' (immediate), 'DAILY_DIGEST' (batched daily), 'WEEKLY_DIGEST' (batched weekly). Default: 'REAL_TIME'.

plainFields.name: quiet_hours_start
plainFields.description: Start time of quiet hours in HH:MM format (24-hour). No notifications sent during quiet hours. Example: '21:00'. Null if quiet hours disabled.

plainFields.name: quiet_hours_end
plainFields.description: End time of quiet hours in HH:MM format (24-hour). Example: '08:00'. Null if quiet hours disabled. Can be next day if wraps midnight.

plainFields.name: quiet_hours_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether quiet hours (do-not-disturb period) are enabled. Default: false.

plainFields.name: unsubscribe_all_marketing
plainFields.description: One-click unsubscribe from all marketing communications. GDPR/CAN-SPAM compliance. Default: false.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when notification settings were first created (usually at user registration).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent notification settings update.

models.name: shopping_mall_categories
models.description: Product categories representing the hierarchical taxonomy of products. This is a foundational system table that organizes all products into logical groupings (e.g., Electronics, Clothing, Home & Garden). Categories are used for product browsing, filtering, and navigation within the platform. Works in conjunction with {@link shopping_mall_category_hierarchy} for multi-level category organization.

plainFields.name: category_name
plainFields.description: Name of the category (e.g., 'Electronics', 'Clothing', 'Home & Garden'). Must be unique within the system to prevent duplicate categories.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Detailed description of what products are included in this category. Helps customers understand the category scope and purpose.

plainFields.name: category_code
plainFields.description: System-generated unique code for the category used in APIs and internal references. Format: uppercase alphanumeric (e.g., 'ELEC', 'CLOTH').

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this category is currently active and visible to customers. Inactive categories are hidden from browse but can be reactivated without data loss.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the category was created in ISO 8601 format (UTC timezone).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the category was last modified. Auto-updated on any changes to category information.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when category was soft-deleted (archived). Null if category is active. Allows recovery of deleted categories.

models.name: shopping_mall_category_hierarchy
models.description: Defines the hierarchical parent-child relationships between categories, enabling multi-level category structures (e.g., Electronics > Computers > Laptops). This allows categories to be organized into a tree structure for improved product navigation and filtering. Works with {@link shopping_mall_categories} to establish the category taxonomy.

foreignFields.name: parent_category_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the parent category's {@link shopping_mall_categories.id}. This establishes the hierarchical relationship. Root-level categories have null parent_id.

foreignFields.name: child_category_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the child category's {@link shopping_mall_categories.id}. This is the subcategory in the hierarchical relationship.

plainFields.name: hierarchy_level
plainFields.description: Depth level in the hierarchy (1 for root, 2 for first-level children, 3 for second-level, etc.). Used for navigation and breadcrumb generation.

plainFields.name: sort_order
plainFields.description: Display order of this subcategory within its parent category siblings. Used for consistent category ordering in UI.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the hierarchy relationship was established.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the hierarchy relationship was last modified.

models.name: shopping_mall_sections
models.description: Major platform sections that organize content and features into distinct areas (e.g., Featured Products, New Arrivals, Flash Sales, Top Sellers). Sections are different from categories - they represent feature areas or promotional sections that may contain products from multiple categories. These are configured by admins to organize the customer shopping experience.

plainFields.name: section_name
plainFields.description: Display name of the section visible to customers (e.g., 'Featured Products', 'New Arrivals', 'Flash Sales'). Should be concise and clear.

plainFields.name: section_type
plainFields.description: Type classification of section (e.g., 'featured', 'new_arrivals', 'flash_sale', 'top_sellers', 'curated'). Used for organizing and filtering sections by type.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Detailed description explaining the section's purpose and what customers can expect to find. Helps customers understand the content.

plainFields.name: sort_order
plainFields.description: Display order of this section on the platform homepage and section pages. Lower numbers appear first.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this section is currently visible to customers. Inactive sections are hidden but can be reactivated.

plainFields.name: is_featured_on_homepage
plainFields.description: Whether this section should be displayed on the platform homepage. Allows selective promotion of important sections.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the section was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the section was last modified.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when section was soft-deleted (archived). Null if section is active.

models.name: shopping_mall_channels
models.description: Distribution channels representing different sales paths or business models (e.g., Direct Sales, Marketplace, B2B Channel, Wholesale, Premium Channel). Channels allow the platform to segment products and sellers for different sales strategies and customer groups. Products and sellers can be assigned to specific channels.

plainFields.name: channel_name
plainFields.description: Name of the sales channel (e.g., 'Direct Sales', 'Marketplace', 'B2B', 'Wholesale', 'Premium'). Identifies the channel for admin configuration.

plainFields.name: channel_code
plainFields.description: System code for the channel used in APIs and internal references. Format: uppercase alphanumeric (e.g., 'DIRECT', 'MARKETPLACE').

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Detailed description of the channel's purpose, target audience, and business model. Helps stakeholders understand channel positioning.

plainFields.name: commission_rate
plainFields.description: Default commission rate (as percentage) for sellers on this channel. Example: 0.10 for 10% commission. Can be overridden per seller.

plainFields.name: min_order_value
plainFields.description: Minimum order value required for purchases on this channel. Orders below this value are not processed. Example: 10.00 for $10 minimum.

plainFields.name: max_order_value
plainFields.description: Maximum order value allowed for purchases on this channel. Orders exceeding this value are rejected. Used to prevent fraud or system issues.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this channel is currently active and accepting orders. Inactive channels are temporarily closed.

plainFields.name: is_public
plainFields.description: Whether this channel is visible to customers. Private channels can be used for internal testing or invitation-only access.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the channel was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the channel was last modified.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when channel was soft-deleted (archived). Null if channel is active.

models.name: shopping_mall_system_configurations
models.description: Global system configuration settings that control platform behavior, policies, and operational parameters. Includes settings for commission rates, refund policies, shipping rules, fraud detection thresholds, and other operational constants. These configurations are managed by admins and affect all users across the platform.

plainFields.name: config_key
plainFields.description: Unique identifier/name for this configuration setting. Format: CONSTANT_CASE (e.g., 'DEFAULT_COMMISSION_RATE', 'REFUND_WINDOW_DAYS', 'MAX_CART_ITEMS'). Used for programmatic access.

plainFields.name: config_value
plainFields.description: The configuration value as a string. Can represent various types (percentage, number, boolean, text, JSON). Must be parsed appropriately by application based on config_key.

plainFields.name: data_type
plainFields.description: Data type of the configuration value (e.g., 'string', 'number', 'boolean', 'percentage', 'json'). Helps application parse the config_value correctly.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Human-readable explanation of what this configuration controls and its impact on platform behavior. Helps admins understand the setting.

plainFields.name: is_editable
plainFields.description: Whether this configuration can be modified by admins. Some critical settings may be read-only after initial setup.

plainFields.name: environment
plainFields.description: Environment where this configuration applies (e.g., 'development', 'staging', 'production', 'all'). Allows different configurations per environment.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this configuration was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this configuration was last modified.

plainFields.name: updated_by
plainFields.description: Admin ID or username who last updated this configuration. For audit trail purposes.

models.name: shopping_mall_feature_flags
models.description: Feature flags enabling/disabling platform features for A/B testing, gradual rollouts, and controlled feature releases. Allows admins to toggle features on/off without code deployment. Supports targeting by user segment (e.g., enable for 10% of users, specific user roles, specific regions).

plainFields.name: feature_name
plainFields.description: Unique identifier for this feature flag (e.g., 'new_checkout_flow', 'ai_recommendations', 'one_click_purchase'). Used to check flag status in application code.

plainFields.name: feature_description
plainFields.description: Human-readable description of what this feature does and why it exists. Helps admins understand the feature's purpose and impact.

plainFields.name: is_enabled
plainFields.description: Master toggle controlling whether this feature is enabled globally. When false, the feature is disabled for all users regardless of other settings.

plainFields.name: rollout_percentage
plainFields.description: Percentage of users who see this feature (0-100). Example: 25 means 25% of users get the feature, 75% don't. Enables gradual rollout.

plainFields.name: target_user_roles
plainFields.description: Comma-separated list of user roles who can access this feature (e.g., 'customer,seller,admin' or 'admin' for admins only). Empty/null means all roles.

plainFields.name: target_regions
plainFields.description: Comma-separated list of country codes where feature is available (e.g., 'US,CA,UK' or 'ALL' for all regions). Enables regional feature testing.

plainFields.name: environment
plainFields.description: Environment where this flag applies (e.g., 'development', 'staging', 'production', 'all'). Allows different flag states per environment.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this feature flag was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this feature flag was last modified.

plainFields.name: created_by
plainFields.description: Admin ID or username who created this feature flag.

plainFields.name: updated_by
plainFields.description: Admin ID or username who last updated this feature flag.

models.name: shopping_mall_products
models.description: Core product entity representing individual products in the shopping mall catalog. Each product is a distinct offering with metadata, category assignment, seller ownership, and status tracking. Products progress through lifecycle states from DRAFT (initial creation) through ACTIVE (published and available for purchase) to INACTIVE (temporarily hidden) or ARCHIVED (historical record). This is the main product table that anchors all variant, image, specification, and approval data. Products are distinct from shopping_mall_product_variants which represent specific SKU combinations with independent pricing.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_seller_id
foreignFields.description: Seller who owns and manages this product. References the seller's {@link shopping_mall_seller.id} account.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_category_id
foreignFields.description: Primary category assignment for product organization and browsing. References {@link shopping_mall_categories.id}. Required for catalog organization.

plainFields.name: product_name
plainFields.description: Display name of the product for catalog and search. Required field between 3-255 characters. Examples: 'Premium Cotton T-Shirt', 'Wireless Bluetooth Headphones'.

plainFields.name: product_description
plainFields.description: Detailed product description and usage information provided by seller. Required field between 10-5000 characters. HTML formatting allowed but sanitized for XSS prevention. Should include material composition, care instructions, and key features.

plainFields.name: brand
plainFields.description: Product brand or manufacturer name. Optional field between 1-100 characters. Examples: 'Nike', 'Samsung', 'Apple'. Used for brand-based filtering in catalog.

plainFields.name: base_price
plainFields.description: Base/default price for the product in platform currency (typically USD). Stored with exactly 2 decimal places. Minimum $0.01, maximum $999,999.99. Individual variant SKUs may have different prices. Used as default when variant-specific pricing not defined.

plainFields.name: weight
plainFields.description: Product weight in kilograms (kg) for shipping cost calculation. Used in logistics and fulfillment operations. Optional field. Example: 0.5 for 500 grams.

plainFields.name: product_status
plainFields.description: Lifecycle status of the product: 'DRAFT' (being created, not visible), 'ACTIVE' (published and available for purchase), 'INACTIVE' (temporarily hidden but data preserved), 'ARCHIVED' (permanently historical record, no new orders). Status determines search visibility and purchase eligibility.

plainFields.name: sku_prefix
plainFields.description: Optional prefix for auto-generated SKU identifiers for this product's variants. Examples: 'TSHIRT', 'HEADPHONE'. Used in variant SKU generation for easier identification of product families.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when product was initially created. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Immutable field set at creation. Used for sorting and audit trails.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last product information modification. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Auto-updated whenever product details change. Used for change tracking and freshness indicators.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when product was soft-deleted. NULL if product is active. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Enables data recovery and audit trail of deletions. Used for implementing soft delete pattern.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_variants
models.description: Product variant entities representing specific SKU (Stock Keeping Unit) combinations with distinct variant attributes (color, size, material, etc.), independent pricing, and inventory tracking. Each variant is a purchasable unit with its own SKU identifier, price, and inventory record in the shopping_mall_inventory_skus table. Multiple variants of the same product enable customers to select specific attribute combinations (e.g., Blue Size-M vs Red Size-L). Variants inherit basic information from parent product but have independent operational characteristics. Each variant maps to exactly one inventory SKU record for stock tracking.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_id
foreignFields.description: Parent product that this variant belongs to. References {@link shopping_mall_products.id}. All variants of a product share the same parent product record.

plainFields.name: sku
plainFields.description: Globally unique Stock Keeping Unit identifier for this specific variant combination. Format typically: {PRODUCT_PREFIX}-{VARIANT_CODE} (e.g., 'TSHIRT-BLU-M' for Blue Medium T-Shirt). Must be unique across entire platform and immutable after creation. Used for inventory tracking, order fulfillment, and customer reference.

plainFields.name: variant_combination_code
plainFields.description: Machine-readable identifier for variant attribute combination. Encodes the specific combination of variant options like color+size. Examples: 'blue-large', 'red-small-cotton'. Used for programmatic variant identification and grouping.

plainFields.name: variant_price
plainFields.description: Price specific to this variant, overriding the product base price if set. Stored with exactly 2 decimal places. Minimum $0.01, maximum $999,999.99. If null, base product price is used. Enables premium pricing for larger sizes or special colors.

plainFields.name: variant_display_order
plainFields.description: Display sequence for ordering variants on product detail page. Lower numbers display first. Used to highlight popular variants or organize presentation logically. Default: 0 (sequential order if not specified).

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this specific variant is available for purchase. False to hide variant without deleting data. Used to temporarily disable variants while preserving order history and inventory records.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when variant was created. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Immutable field. Used for audit trail and variant lifecycle tracking.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last variant modification. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Auto-updated on changes to pricing, status, or variant attributes.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_variant_options
models.description: Individual variant attribute values that compose product variants. Each record represents an atomic variant attribute (e.g., Color='Blue', Size='Large', Material='Cotton'). Multiple variant_options combine to form a complete variant combination. For example, a T-shirt variant 'TSHIRT-BLU-M' is composed of: variant_option(Color=Blue), variant_option(Size=Medium). These options enable flexible variant definition and searchable attribute filtering in product catalog.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_variant_id
foreignFields.description: Parent variant that contains this option. References {@link shopping_mall_product_variants.id}. Multiple variant_options belong to each variant.

plainFields.name: option_type
plainFields.description: Type/category of variant attribute. Standard types: 'color' (Color/Finish), 'size' (Size dimension), 'material' (Material composition), 'style' (Alternative style), 'pattern' (Visual pattern), 'configuration' (Product-specific config). Used for organizing variant attributes logically.

plainFields.name: option_value
plainFields.description: Specific value for this variant attribute. Examples for color: 'Blue', 'Red', 'Black'; for size: 'Small', 'Medium', 'Large'; for material: 'Cotton', 'Polyester'. Used for customer-facing variant selection display and filtering.

plainFields.name: option_display_order
plainFields.description: Display sequence for ordering this option within its type. Lower numbers display first. Used to highlight preferred options or organize presentation. Default: 0.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when variant option was created. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Immutable field used for audit trail.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_images
models.description: Product images for visual catalog presentation. Each image represents a single product photo with ordering for display sequencing on product detail pages. Exactly one image per product should be marked as primary (used as thumbnail in search results and category listings). Images are stored as URI references to external image storage (CDN) rather than as BLOB data in database. Soft deletion is implemented through status changes rather than hard deletion to preserve order history references.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_id
foreignFields.description: Product that this image belongs to. References {@link shopping_mall_products.id}. Multiple images can belong to single product.

plainFields.name: image_url
plainFields.description: URL/URI pointing to the actual image file stored in CDN or external storage. Should be a direct HTTP(S) link to the image file. Examples: 'https://cdn.example.com/products/img123.jpg', 'https://storage.example.com/images/product456.png'. Never stored as BLOB in database.

plainFields.name: is_primary
plainFields.description: Whether this image is the primary/thumbnail image for the product. Only one image per product should have is_primary=true. Used in search results, category listings, and product cards. Used for determining which image to display when full gallery not available.

plainFields.name: image_display_order
plainFields.description: Display sequence for image ordering in product gallery. Lower numbers display first. Used to show product photos in seller-preferred order. Typically: primary image first (order 0), then additional angles/details.

plainFields.name: alt_text
plainFields.description: Accessibility alt text describing image content for screen readers. Should clearly describe what the image shows. Example: 'Blue cotton t-shirt worn by model, showing front design'. Used for accessibility compliance and SEO.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when image record was created. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Immutable field used for audit trail.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_specifications
models.description: Product specifications and detailed attribute information stored as flexible key-value pairs. Specifications include technical details like dimensions, weight, material composition, care instructions, battery life, processor specs, etc. This model provides extensible attribute storage without requiring schema changes for new specification types. Unlike rigid structured fields, specifications allow sellers to define arbitrary attributes relevant to their product categories.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_id
foreignFields.description: Product that this specification describes. References {@link shopping_mall_products.id}. Multiple specifications can describe single product.

plainFields.name: spec_key
plainFields.description: Specification attribute name/key. Examples: 'material', 'dimensions', 'weight', 'battery_life', 'processor', 'memory', 'color', 'warranty_period'. Seller-defined keys allow flexible attribute representation without schema modifications.

plainFields.name: spec_value
plainFields.description: Specification attribute value. Examples: 'Cotton 100%', '10cm x 5cm x 2cm', '250g', '20 hours', 'Intel i7', '16GB', 'Care: Hand wash only, dry flat'. Can store complex specification details as text.

plainFields.name: spec_display_order
plainFields.description: Display sequence for specification on product detail page. Lower numbers display first. Organizes specifications in logical groupings (e.g., material specs before care specs).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when specification was added. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Immutable field used for audit trail.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_tags
models.description: Searchable tags for product categorization, SEO optimization, and enhanced product discovery beyond the hierarchical category system. Tags enable cross-category product finding and flexible organization. Unlike rigid category hierarchies, tags allow multiple overlapping classifications (e.g., 'outdoor', 'waterproof', 'summer-collection', 'trending' on same product). Tags are indexed for full-text search enabling customers to find products by multiple faceted attributes.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_id
foreignFields.description: Product that this tag is applied to. References {@link shopping_mall_products.id}. Multiple tags can be applied to single product.

plainFields.name: tag_name
plainFields.description: Searchable tag keyword for product discovery. Examples: 'eco-friendly', 'bestseller', 'new-arrival', 'premium', 'outdoor', 'waterproof', 'organic'. Tags enable flexible faceted search and product filtering beyond category hierarchy. Should be lowercase, hyphen-separated for consistency.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when tag was applied to product. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Immutable field used for audit trail.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_approvals
models.description: Audit trail and approval workflow history for product submissions and modifications. Captures all product approval decisions made by administrators including approval/rejection decisions, timestamps, and admin notes. This snapshot/audit table preserves complete product lifecycle history tracking when products were submitted, approved, rejected, and why. Each approval record is immutable, creating a complete accountability record for product catalog governance. Multiple approval records per product track submission iterations (e.g., initial rejection, resubmission, approval).

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_id
foreignFields.description: Product that was approved or rejected. References {@link shopping_mall_products.id}. Multiple approval records track approval history for single product.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator who made the approval decision. References {@link shopping_mall_admin.id}. Tracks accountability for approval decisions.

plainFields.name: approval_status
plainFields.description: Decision on product approval: 'PENDING' (awaiting admin review), 'APPROVED' (product published to catalog), 'REJECTED' (product not approved, returned for corrections). Tracks product submission outcomes.

plainFields.name: admin_notes
plainFields.description: Administrative notes explaining approval decision or rejection reason. For approvals: general comments. For rejections: specific issues requiring correction (e.g., 'Image resolution too low - minimum 1000x1000px required', 'Product description contains prohibited keywords'). Max 2000 characters for detailed feedback.

plainFields.name: decision_timestamp
plainFields.description: Timestamp when approval decision was made. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Records exact moment of approval/rejection decision. Immutable field used for accountability and audit trail.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when approval record was created. ISO 8601 format in UTC. Typically matches decision_timestamp but may differ if retroactive recording occurs. Immutable audit field.

models.name: shopping_mall_inventory_skus
models.description: Master SKU inventory records tracking unique product variants with seller ownership. Represents each Stock Keeping Unit (color, size, options combination) separately for independent inventory management. Links to product variants and enables multi-warehouse inventory operations. Core table for inventory domain that connects to all inventory transactions and stock levels.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_variant_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to product variant defining this SKU's characteristics. {@link shopping_mall_product_variants.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to seller who owns and manages this SKU's inventory. {@link shopping_mall_seller.id}

plainFields.name: sku_code
plainFields.description: Unique SKU identifier code combining product ID and variant options (e.g., PROD-123-BLU-M). Used for human reference and order line item tracking.

plainFields.name: reorder_level
plainFields.description: Minimum inventory threshold before low stock alert triggers. Seller configurable, typically 10 units. Helps seller manage restocking proactively.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current SKU status: active (available for sale), inactive (temporarily unavailable but data preserved), discontinued (no longer sold, archived). Controls whether SKU appears in catalog.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this SKU was created, typically when product variant is first set up for inventory tracking.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last modification timestamp for SKU metadata. Updated when status or reorder level changes.

models.name: shopping_mall_inventory_quantities
models.description: Real-time stock quantity tracking at SKU level. Maintains current on-hand inventory, reserved quantities (committed to orders), and calculated available quantities. Critical for preventing overselling. Optimized for frequent reads and updates during order processing. Separate from transactions table for performance.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_inventory_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the SKU master record for which this quantity record maintains stock levels. {@link shopping_mall_inventory_skus.id}

plainFields.name: current_quantity
plainFields.description: Total on-hand inventory units available (should never be negative). Decreases when orders confirmed, increases when returns received or manual adjustments add stock.

plainFields.name: reserved_quantity
plainFields.description: Inventory units committed to confirmed but not yet shipped orders. Reserved = placed in active orders, not available for new orders. Calculated from reservation records.

plainFields.name: available_quantity
plainFields.description: Calculated field: current_quantity minus reserved_quantity. Represents actual available inventory for new orders. Read-only calculated value.

plainFields.name: last_updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent inventory change (order, adjustment, return, etc.). Enables tracking of inventory update frequency for monitoring purposes.

models.name: shopping_mall_inventory_transactions
models.description: Immutable audit trail of all inventory changes (orders, adjustments, returns, damages). Append-only transaction log ensuring complete accountability for every inventory unit moved. Supports compliance auditing, historical analysis, and reconciliation. Snapshot stance because transactions are permanent historical records never modified after creation.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_inventory_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the SKU affected by this transaction. {@link shopping_mall_inventory_skus.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to order that triggered this inventory transaction, if applicable. {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_inventory_adjustment_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to manual adjustment request that triggered this transaction, if applicable. {@link shopping_mall_inventory_adjustments.id}

plainFields.name: transaction_type
plainFields.description: Type of transaction: order_fulfillment (inventory allocated to order), order_cancellation (order cancelled, inventory restored), return_received (customer returned items), manual_adjustment (seller or admin adjusted stock), damage_reported (items damaged or lost), inventory_correction (system correction).

plainFields.name: quantity_change
plainFields.description: Net quantity change: positive for additions (returns, restocks), negative for deductions (orders, damage). Can be positive or negative depending on transaction type.

plainFields.name: quantity_before
plainFields.description: Inventory quantity before this transaction. Enables before/after verification and reconciliation.

plainFields.name: quantity_after
plainFields.description: Inventory quantity after this transaction. Should equal quantity_before + quantity_change.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Detailed reason for transaction from predefined list: Restock, Damage/Loss, Physical Count Correction, Return Received, System Error Correction, Order Fulfillment, Other. Helps categorize and analyze inventory changes.

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Optional detailed notes about the transaction (max 500 characters). May include explanation of discrepancies, damage details, or adjustment justification.

plainFields.name: initiated_by_type
plainFields.description: Type of user initiating transaction: seller (seller-initiated adjustment), admin (admin-initiated correction), system (automatic order/return processing). Tracks responsibility for changes.

plainFields.name: initiated_by_id
plainFields.description: UUID of user (seller or admin) or system identifier initiating this transaction. Enables audit trail showing who made change.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which transaction was initiated, if applicable (seller/admin adjustment). Null for system-generated transactions. Security audit trail.

plainFields.name: transaction_timestamp
plainFields.description: Exact timestamp when transaction occurred. Enables precise sequencing of inventory changes for reconciliation.

models.name: shopping_mall_inventory_reservations
models.description: Inventory holds for pending or processing orders. Tracks reserved quantities to prevent overselling when multiple customers simultaneously purchase limited stock. Reservation timeout mechanism (15 minutes typical) releases expired holds. Bridges order system with inventory tracking for concurrent safety. Primary stance because sellers may directly query their reservations.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_inventory_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to SKU whose inventory is being reserved. {@link shopping_mall_inventory_skus.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to order for which inventory is reserved. {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_item_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to specific order line item being reserved. {@link shopping_mall_order_items.id}

plainFields.name: reserved_quantity
plainFields.description: Number of units reserved for this order item. Subtracted from available inventory until order confirms or reservation expires.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Reservation status: reserved (hold active), released (hold cancelled/expired), committed (converted to permanent allocation). Tracks lifecycle of hold.

plainFields.name: reserved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when inventory was reserved for this order. Marks start of hold period.

plainFields.name: reservation_expires_at
plainFields.description: When this reservation automatically expires if not converted to confirmed order (typically 15 minutes after reserved_at). Prevents indefinite holds.

plainFields.name: confirmed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when reservation was confirmed (converted to permanent inventory allocation when order payment processed). Null if still reserved or released.

plainFields.name: released_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when reservation was released (order cancelled, session timeout, or refund processed). Null if still reserved or committed.

models.name: shopping_mall_inventory_adjustments
models.description: Records seller-initiated inventory quantity adjustments for restock, damage corrections, or physical count discrepancies. Requires documentation of reason and optional admin approval for certain adjustment types. Bridges manual operations with inventory transaction audit trail. Enables tracking of all inventory modifications with approval workflows.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_inventory_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to SKU being adjusted. {@link shopping_mall_inventory_skus.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to seller initiating this adjustment. {@link shopping_mall_seller.id}

plainFields.name: adjustment_type
plainFields.description: Type of adjustment: restock (adding new inventory), correction (fixing count discrepancy), damage (removing damaged units), loss (theft/missing units), return_received (manual return entry), other. Categorizes reason for change.

plainFields.name: quantity_change
plainFields.description: Net quantity adjustment: positive for additions (restocking), negative for removals (damage, correction). Applied to current inventory.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Detailed reason for adjustment from predefined list: Restock, Damage/Loss, Physical Count Correction, Return Received, System Error Correction, Other. Explains justification for change.

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Optional seller notes providing additional context (max 1000 characters). May explain discrepancy details, damage circumstances, or correction justification.

plainFields.name: requires_approval
plainFields.description: Whether this adjustment requires admin approval before taking effect (true for damage/loss/corrections exceeding threshold, false for routine restock). Controls workflow.

plainFields.name: approval_status
plainFields.description: Status of approval workflow: pending (awaiting admin review), approved (admin approved, applied), rejected (admin rejected, not applied). If requires_approval=false, defaults to approved immediately.

plainFields.name: approved_by_id
plainFields.description: Admin ID who approved or rejected this adjustment. Null if pending or not requiring approval. Tracks admin accountability.

plainFields.name: approval_notes
plainFields.description: Admin comments on approval/rejection decision (max 500 characters). Explains approval reasoning or rejection justification.

plainFields.name: requested_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when seller submitted adjustment request. Marks beginning of approval workflow.

plainFields.name: approved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when adjustment was approved and applied. Null if pending or rejected.

models.name: shopping_mall_low_stock_alerts
models.description: Alerts triggered when SKU inventory falls below seller-configured reorder level threshold. Tracks alert generation, seller acknowledgment, and resolution status. Supports seller notifications and inventory management workflows. Enables inventory forecasting showing estimated days to stockout based on sales velocity. Helps prevent unexpected stock shortages.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_inventory_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to SKU that triggered the low stock alert. {@link shopping_mall_inventory_skus.id}
