plainFields.name: alert_type
plainFields.description: Type of alert: low_stock (below threshold but>0), out_of_stock (quantity=0), critical_stock (below 5 units). Differentiates severity of inventory situation.

plainFields.name: threshold_value
plainFields.description: Reorder threshold that was breached to trigger this alert. Typically 10 units or seller-configured value. For reference to understand alert trigger.

plainFields.name: current_quantity
plainFields.description: SKU quantity at time alert was triggered. Captures stock level context for alert history.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Alert status: pending (new alert, not yet addressed), acknowledged (seller reviewed), resolved (inventory restocked/addressed). Tracks alert lifecycle.

plainFields.name: estimated_days_to_stockout
plainFields.description: Forecast of days until inventory reaches zero based on recent sales velocity. Helps seller prioritize restocking urgency. Null if insufficient sales history.

plainFields.name: recent_sales_velocity
plainFields.description: Average units sold per day in last 30 days. Used to calculate estimated_days_to_stockout. Null if insufficient sales history.

plainFields.name: alert_triggered_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when alert was generated and detected by system. Marks when stock fell below threshold.

plainFields.name: acknowledged_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when seller acknowledged/reviewed this alert. Null if still pending.

plainFields.name: resolved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when alert was resolved (inventory was restocked or issue addressed). Null if still pending or acknowledged.

models.name: shopping_mall_inventory_history
models.description: Historical snapshots of SKU inventory quantities at point-in-time intervals for reporting and trend analysis. Complements transaction log with period summaries. Enables historical reporting, forecasting, and inventory trending analysis. Read-only archival data supporting business intelligence. Snapshot stance because records are immutable historical captures.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_inventory_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to SKU for which this is a historical snapshot. {@link shopping_mall_inventory_skus.id}

plainFields.name: current_quantity
plainFields.description: SKU quantity at snapshot time. Captures point-in-time inventory level for historical tracking.

plainFields.name: reserved_quantity
plainFields.description: SKU reserved quantity at snapshot time. Shows how much inventory was on hold for pending orders.

plainFields.name: available_quantity
plainFields.description: Calculated available quantity at snapshot time (current - reserved). Shows actual sellable inventory at historical point.

plainFields.name: snapshot_period
plainFields.description: Snapshot aggregation period: daily (once per day), weekly (once per week), monthly (once per month). Helps categorize history granularity.

plainFields.name: snapshot_date
plainFields.description: Date (typically end of period) for which this snapshot was taken. For daily snapshots, represents that calendar day.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this historical snapshot record was created/captured. Precise timing of when snapshot was recorded.

models.name: shopping_mall_shopping_carts
models.description: Customer shopping carts representing temporary collections of items prepared for purchase. Each authenticated customer has at most one active cart at any given time. Carts track items the customer intends to buy in current session, with status lifecycle (active, abandoned, converted_to_order). Carts persist across sessions enabling interrupted shopping experiences. Related to {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}.

foreignFields.name: customer_id
foreignFields.description: Customer who owns this shopping cart. Reference to {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Cart status lifecycle: 'active' (current shopping), 'abandoned' (inactive 30+ days), 'converted_to_order' (checkout completed). Tracks cart state for recovery campaigns and analytics.

plainFields.name: total_items
plainFields.description: Denormalized count of items in cart (updated on item addition/removal) for quick dashboard display without joins. Should match sum of quantities in shopping_cart_items.

plainFields.name: subtotal_amount
plainFields.description: Denormalized subtotal of all items (price  quantity per item, summed). Calculated from cart items but cached here for performance. In seller's currency.

plainFields.name: estimated_tax
plainFields.description: Estimated tax based on current delivery address and product types. Recalculated when address changes or items added. Null if no address selected yet.

plainFields.name: estimated_shipping
plainFields.description: Estimated shipping cost based on destination address and selected shipping method. Null if address or method not yet selected.

plainFields.name: promo_code
plainFields.description: Applied promotional code if customer entered discount code. Null if no promo applied. Used to validate discount applicability.

plainFields.name: discount_amount
plainFields.description: Discount amount from applied promo code or store credits. In seller's currency. Zero if no discount.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when cart was created. ISO 8601 format, UTC timezone.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when cart was last modified (item added/removed/quantity changed). ISO 8601 format, UTC timezone.

plainFields.name: abandoned_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when cart was marked as abandoned. Null while cart is active. Used for recovery campaign targeting.

plainFields.name: converted_to_order_id
plainFields.description: If cart was converted to order, stores the resulting order ID for reference. Null for active/abandoned carts. Enables tracking cartorder conversion.

models.name: shopping_mall_shopping_cart_items
models.description: Individual items within a shopping cart. Each cart item represents one product variant (SKU) at a specific quantity with price snapshot. Items store prices at addition time to prevent price-change surprises during shopping. Multiple cart items can reference same SKU from different customers. Related to {@link shopping_mall_shopping_carts.id} and {@link shopping_mall_product_variants.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_cart_id
foreignFields.description: Shopping cart this item belongs to. Reference to {@link shopping_mall_shopping_carts.id}.

foreignFields.name: product_variant_id
foreignFields.description: Product variant (SKU) being added to cart. Reference to {@link shopping_mall_product_variants.id}.

plainFields.name: quantity
plainFields.description: Number of units of this SKU in the cart. Must be positive integer (1-999 per business rules). Customer can adjust this value.

plainFields.name: unit_price_snapshot
plainFields.description: Price of one unit at time item was added to cart. Captured for historical accuracy - prevents price increase surprises. In seller's currency.

plainFields.name: line_total
plainFields.description: Total for this line item (unit_price_snapshot  quantity). Calculated at addition, may differ from current price if product price changed.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when item was added to cart. ISO 8601 format, UTC timezone.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when item details were last modified (quantity changed). ISO 8601 format, UTC timezone.

models.name: shopping_mall_wishlists
models.description: Customer wishlists for saving products to review later. Each customer can create multiple wishlists (e.g., 'Birthday Gift Ideas', 'Home Decor', 'Tech Wishlist'). Wishlists persist indefinitely enabling long-term shopping plans and price tracking. Unlike carts, wishlists don't convert to orders but rather customers add items from wishlist to cart. Related to {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}.

foreignFields.name: customer_id
foreignFields.description: Customer who owns this wishlist. Reference to {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Display name for wishlist provided by customer. Examples: 'Birthday Ideas', 'Home Decor', 'Tech Gadgets'. Max 100 characters.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Optional description of wishlist purpose. Max 500 characters. Helps customer remember what this wishlist is for.

plainFields.name: is_public
plainFields.description: Whether this wishlist is publicly shareable with others or private to customer only. True = shareable link generated, false = private.

plainFields.name: total_items
plainFields.description: Denormalized count of items in wishlist for quick display. Should match count in wishlist_items table.

plainFields.name: total_value
plainFields.description: Denormalized sum of current prices of all items in wishlist. Used to show customer total value of saved items.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when wishlist was created. ISO 8601 format, UTC timezone.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when wishlist was last modified (item added/removed). ISO 8601 format, UTC timezone.

models.name: shopping_mall_wishlist_items
models.description: Individual items saved in a wishlist. Each wishlist item represents one product variant (SKU) customer wants to track. Unlike cart items, wishlist items don't have quantity (one per item - customer can add to cart with desired quantity later). Stores price history to track if item is on sale. Related to {@link shopping_mall_wishlists.id} and {@link shopping_mall_product_variants.id}.

foreignFields.name: wishlist_id
foreignFields.description: Wishlist this item belongs to. Reference to {@link shopping_mall_wishlists.id}.

foreignFields.name: product_variant_id
foreignFields.description: Product variant (SKU) saved in wishlist. Reference to {@link shopping_mall_product_variants.id}.

plainFields.name: price_when_added
plainFields.description: Price of product when customer added it to wishlist. Stored to track price changes - enables 'item on sale' notifications. In seller's currency.

plainFields.name: priority
plainFields.description: Wishlist item priority: 'low', 'medium', 'high'. Allows customer to mark must-have items. Helps with gift registry use cases.

plainFields.name: customer_notes
plainFields.description: Personal notes customer can add about why they saved this item. Max 500 characters. Examples: 'Color preference: Blue', 'Size: Large'.

plainFields.name: price_drop_notified
plainFields.description: Whether customer has already been notified about a price drop on this item. Prevents duplicate notifications.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when item was added to wishlist. ISO 8601 format, UTC timezone.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when wishlist item was last modified (notes changed, priority changed). ISO 8601 format, UTC timezone.

models.name: shopping_mall_orders
models.description: Main order records capturing complete customer purchases with transactional context. Each order represents a committed transaction from a customer containing one or more items from potentially multiple sellers. Orders maintain immutable pricing snapshots and track complete lifecycle from creation through fulfillment or cancellation. Central hub linking customers to their purchases with complete billing and shipping information.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Owned customer's {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_payment_id
foreignFields.description: Associated payment transaction's {@link shopping_mall_payments.id}

plainFields.name: order_number
plainFields.description: Human-readable order number in format ORD-YYYYMMDD-XXXXXX for customer reference. Unique identifier visible to customer.

plainFields.name: order_status
plainFields.description: Current order lifecycle status: PENDING (awaiting payment), CONFIRMED (payment received), PROCESSING (seller preparing), SHIPPED (handed to carrier), DELIVERED (received by customer), COMPLETED (order finalized), CANCELLED (cancelled), RETURNED (return processed). Immutable status history maintained in order_status_history table.

plainFields.name: payment_status
plainFields.description: Payment status: PENDING (awaiting payment processing), COMPLETED (payment received and captured), FAILED (payment declined/failed), REFUNDED (refund issued). Tracks payment lifecycle independent of order status.

plainFields.name: shipping_status
plainFields.description: Shipping/fulfillment status: NOT_SHIPPED (not yet sent), IN_TRANSIT (with carrier), DELIVERED (confirmed delivery), EXCEPTION (delivery issue). Updated from shipment tracking.

plainFields.name: subtotal
plainFields.description: Calculated sum of all order items (unit_price  quantity for each item). Excludes taxes and shipping. Snapshot value at order time.

plainFields.name: tax_amount
plainFields.description: Calculated tax amount based on delivery address jurisdiction and applicable tax rate. Immutable snapshot at order confirmation time.

plainFields.name: tax_rate
plainFields.description: Tax rate percentage applied to this order (e.g., 0.08 for 8%). Stored for historical accuracy and audit purposes.

plainFields.name: shipping_cost
plainFields.description: Selected shipping method cost. Calculated based on destination, weight, and shipping method selected by customer. Immutable after confirmation.

plainFields.name: shipping_method
plainFields.description: Selected shipping method name: Standard (5-7 days), Express (2-3 days), Overnight (1 day), Same-Day (same day for local), Economy (7-14 days). Determines delivery timeline and cost.

plainFields.name: discount_amount
plainFields.description: Total discount amount applied from promotional codes or platform promotions. Snapshot value at order confirmation. Stored for financial reporting and audit.

plainFields.name: total_amount
plainFields.description: Final order total: subtotal + tax + shipping - discount. This is the amount charged to customer. Immutable after payment confirmation for billing accuracy.

plainFields.name: delivery_address
plainFields.description: Complete delivery address in JSON format captured at order time: {street, city, state, zip, country, recipient_name, phone}. Immutable snapshot ensures historical accuracy if customer changes address later.

plainFields.name: billing_address
plainFields.description: Complete billing address in JSON format captured at order time. May differ from delivery address. Used for payment processing and verification.

plainFields.name: customer_email
plainFields.description: Customer email address at time of order (snapshot). Ensures confirmation emails can be sent even if customer updates email later.

plainFields.name: customer_phone
plainFields.description: Customer phone number at time of order (snapshot). Used for shipping coordination if needed.

plainFields.name: order_notes
plainFields.description: Internal platform notes about order for admin/support. Limited to 500 characters. Examples: special handling, customer service issues, fulfillment notes.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Order creation timestamp in ISO 8601 UTC. Marks when customer initiated checkout and order was created in PENDING status.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last modification timestamp. Updated when order status changes, payment confirmed, or administrative updates occur.

plainFields.name: confirmed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when payment was successfully confirmed and order transitioned to CONFIRMED status. Null until payment completes.

plainFields.name: cancelled_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when order was cancelled. Null for non-cancelled orders. Set when order transitions to CANCELLED status.

plainFields.name: refund_status
plainFields.description: Refund status if applicable: NO_REFUND (no refund needed), PENDING (refund requested but not processed), PROCESSING (refund in progress), COMPLETED (refund issued), REJECTED (refund denied). Tracks refund lifecycle separate from order status.

models.name: shopping_mall_order_items
models.description: Line items within orders representing individual products with quantities and pricing. Each order contains one or more items which may be from different sellers. Items capture immutable price snapshots at order time ensuring billing accuracy. Items are managed exclusively through parent order operations and represent the detailed product composition of each purchase.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: Parent order's {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_variant_id
foreignFields.description: SKU variant's {@link shopping_mall_product_variants.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_seller_id
foreignFields.description: Seller owning this product's {@link shopping_mall_seller.id}

plainFields.name: product_name
plainFields.description: Product name snapshot at order time. Captured immutably so order displays original product name even if seller updates name later.

plainFields.name: variant_details
plainFields.description: Variant details JSON snapshot: {color, size, material, other_options}. Documents exact variant customer ordered (e.g., 'Blue, Size M, Cotton').

plainFields.name: unit_price
plainFields.description: Price per unit at time of order (immutable snapshot). This is the price charged, not affected by any later price changes by seller.

plainFields.name: quantity
plainFields.description: Number of units ordered for this line item. Positive integer between 1 and 999.

plainFields.name: line_total
plainFields.description: Line item total: unit_price  quantity (immutable). Pre-calculated and stored for quick access and audit trail.

plainFields.name: item_status
plainFields.description: Individual item fulfillment status within order: PENDING (awaiting fulfillment), PROCESSING (seller preparing), SHIPPED (shipped), DELIVERED (received), CANCELLED (item cancelled), RETURNED (returned by customer). Enables per-item tracking in multi-seller orders.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Line item creation timestamp. Same as parent order creation time (set when order is created).

models.name: shopping_mall_order_status_history
models.description: Audit trail capturing every order status transition with complete metadata for compliance and troubleshooting. Each record documents when and why order status changed, who made the change, and supporting notes. Implements snapshot pattern for historical accuracy - append-only records never modified after creation. Essential for dispute resolution, SLA tracking, and operational auditing.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: Order being tracked's {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}

plainFields.name: status_from
plainFields.description: Previous order status before this transition (e.g., PENDING, CONFIRMED, PROCESSING). Documents the state being transitioned from.

plainFields.name: status_to
plainFields.description: New order status after this transition (e.g., CONFIRMED, PROCESSING, SHIPPED). Documents the new state being entered.

plainFields.name: changed_by
plainFields.description: Identifier of who triggered the status change: admin_user_id, seller_id, system, customer. Tracks origin of status change for audit.

plainFields.name: changed_by_type
plainFields.description: Type of entity making the change: ADMIN, SELLER, SYSTEM, CUSTOMER. Helps identify source of change for auditing.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Explanation for the status change. Examples: 'Payment received', 'Seller accepted order', 'Customer cancelled', 'Delivery confirmed'. Limited to 500 characters.

plainFields.name: admin_notes
plainFields.description: Internal admin notes about this status change. Used for documenting special circumstances or operational decisions. Limited to 1000 characters.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address of the entity making the change. Used for security audit trail. Can be null for system-generated changes.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: User agent/device info for the entity making the change. Helps track which system/device initiated change.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when status transition occurred. Records exact moment of change for audit trail.

models.name: shopping_mall_order_notes
models.description: Flexible note system for operational and administrative communication about orders. Captures notes from sellers, customers, and admins with visibility controls determining who can see each note. Enables tracking of special requests, fulfillment issues, customer service interactions, and internal coordination. Notes are append-only (not edited after creation) for audit trail integrity.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: Associated order's {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}

plainFields.name: note_type
plainFields.description: Type of note: INTERNAL_ADMIN (admin-only internal notes), CUSTOMER_VISIBLE (customer can see on order), SELLER_NOTE (seller-to-admin communication), CUSTOMER_REQUEST (customer-provided special requests). Determines visibility and context.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Note text content. Maximum 5000 characters. Examples: special delivery instructions, customer service issues, fulfillment coordination, operational notes.

plainFields.name: created_by
plainFields.description: Identifier of who created the note: admin_id, seller_id, customer_id, or 'system'. Tracks origin for audit.

plainFields.name: created_by_type
plainFields.description: Type of creator: ADMIN, SELLER, CUSTOMER, SYSTEM. Indicates role of person/system creating the note.

plainFields.name: visibility_scope
plainFields.description: Who can view this note: ADMIN_ONLY (admin and support staff), SELLER_ONLY (seller and admin), CUSTOMER_VISIBLE (customer, seller, and admin), INTERNAL (all internal parties). Controls access per business rules.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Note creation timestamp. Immutable - notes have permanent creation time.

models.name: shopping_mall_order_timestamps
models.description: Complete lifecycle timestamps for order tracking and SLA management. Captures all significant temporal events in order progression from creation through fulfillment or cancellation. Separates timestamp concerns from main orders table for clarity and enables efficient timeline queries. All timestamps stored in UTC ISO 8601 format. Implements 1:1 relationship with shopping_mall_orders enabling optional addition without polluting main table.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: Corresponding order's {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Order creation timestamp. When order was first placed in PENDING status. Marks start of order lifecycle.

plainFields.name: confirmed_at
plainFields.description: Payment confirmation timestamp. When payment was successfully processed and order transitioned to CONFIRMED status. Null until payment completes.

plainFields.name: processing_started_at
plainFields.description: Fulfillment start timestamp. When seller marked order as PROCESSING and began preparing items. Null until seller begins fulfillment.

plainFields.name: shipped_at
plainFields.description: Shipment timestamp. When seller provided tracking number and order transitioned to SHIPPED status. Marks handoff to carrier.

plainFields.name: delivered_at
plainFields.description: Delivery confirmation timestamp. When carrier confirmed delivery and order transitioned to DELIVERED status. Marks customer receipt.

plainFields.name: completed_at
plainFields.description: Order completion timestamp. When order transitioned to COMPLETED status, typically 7 days after delivery when return window closes. Marks end of active order lifecycle.

plainFields.name: cancelled_at
plainFields.description: Cancellation timestamp. When order was cancelled and transitioned to CANCELLED status. Null for non-cancelled orders.

plainFields.name: refunded_at
plainFields.description: Refund completion timestamp. When refund was successfully processed and paid to customer. Null if no refund occurred.

plainFields.name: last_updated_at
plainFields.description: Last status update timestamp. Most recent timestamp when any order event occurred. Used for identifying recently active orders.

models.name: shopping_mall_payments
models.description: Main payment records for customer orders. Stores complete payment information including payment method, amount, status, and order reference. Serves as the primary transaction record for all customer payments processed through the platform. Links each payment to a specific order and customer for financial tracking and reconciliation.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Customer making the payment. References {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_payment_method_id
foreignFields.description: Payment method used for this payment. References {@link shopping_mall_payment_methods.id}.

plainFields.name: amount
plainFields.description: Amount charged to customer in smallest currency unit (e.g., cents for USD). Must match order total exactly with no variance.

plainFields.name: currency_code
plainFields.description: ISO 4217 currency code for payment (e.g., USD, EUR, GBP). Must match order currency code.

plainFields.name: payment_status
plainFields.description: Current payment status: PENDING (awaiting processing), COMPLETED (successfully charged), FAILED (declined or error), REFUNDED (money returned), DISPUTED (chargeback filed). Status transitions are: PENDING  COMPLETED|FAILED, COMPLETED  REFUNDED|DISPUTED.

plainFields.name: payment_method_type
plainFields.description: Type of payment method: CREDIT_CARD (Visa, Mastercard, etc.), DEBIT_CARD, DIGITAL_WALLET (Apple Pay, Google Pay), BANK_TRANSFER. Snapshot of method type at time of payment.

plainFields.name: settlement_status
plainFields.description: Settlement status with payment processor: NOT_SETTLED (awaiting batch settlement), SETTLED (funds received by merchant), DISPUTED (funds held due to chargeback), CHARGEDBACK (customer won dispute). Tracks fund availability.

plainFields.name: error_code
plainFields.description: Payment processor error code if payment failed. Examples: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS, CARD_EXPIRED, FRAUD_DETECTED, NETWORK_ERROR. Null for successful payments.

plainFields.name: error_message
plainFields.description: Human-readable error message from payment gateway if payment failed. For customer communication and troubleshooting.

plainFields.name: idempotency_key
plainFields.description: Unique idempotency key to prevent duplicate charge attempts. Combines order ID, customer ID, and timestamp. Used to detect and reject duplicate payment submissions.

plainFields.name: attempts
plainFields.description: Number of payment processing attempts made for this order. Starts at 1. Incremented on automatic retry. Helps identify problematic payments requiring manual review.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when payment record was created (payment initiated by customer).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last payment status update.

plainFields.name: completed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when payment was successfully completed or finally failed. Null until payment reaches terminal state.

plainFields.name: settled_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when payment settlement was confirmed by payment processor. Null until funds are actually received.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp. Null for active records. Set when payment is archived (no longer needed for active operations).

models.name: shopping_mall_payment_transactions
models.description: Individual transaction records for each payment processing attempt. Multiple transactions can exist per payment if retry logic is triggered. Each transaction captures complete request/response details with payment gateway including authorization codes, processor references, and all transaction metadata. Supports payment reconciliation and transaction tracking.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_payment_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to parent payment record. Links this transaction to {@link shopping_mall_payments.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_payment_gateway_record_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to payment gateway record with external processor details. Links to {@link shopping_mall_payment_gateway_records.id}.

plainFields.name: transaction_sequence
plainFields.description: Sequence number of this transaction attempt (1 for first attempt, 2 for first retry, etc.). Helps identify transaction history and retry attempts.

plainFields.name: transaction_type
plainFields.description: Type of transaction: AUTHORIZATION (card authorization), CAPTURE (fund capture), REFUND (refund processing), VOID (cancellation). Tracks transaction purpose.

plainFields.name: amount
plainFields.description: Amount involved in this specific transaction in smallest currency unit. May differ from parent payment amount if partial transaction.

plainFields.name: transaction_status
plainFields.description: Transaction status: SUBMITTED (sent to gateway), PROCESSING (gateway processing), APPROVED (gateway approved), DECLINED (gateway declined), ERROR (technical error), TIMEOUT (no response received within timeout period).

plainFields.name: gateway_response_code
plainFields.description: Code returned by payment gateway (e.g., 00 for approval, 05 for declined). Specific to payment processor used.

plainFields.name: gateway_response_message
plainFields.description: Message returned by payment gateway describing transaction result. May be error description or success confirmation.

plainFields.name: authorization_code
plainFields.description: Authorization code from payment processor for approved transactions. Used for settlement and reconciliation. Null for declined/error transactions.

plainFields.name: processor_transaction_id
plainFields.description: Unique transaction identifier assigned by payment processor. Used for dispute investigation and transaction lookup with payment provider.

plainFields.name: avs_result_code
plainFields.description: Address Verification System result code from processor. Examples: M (match), N (no match), U (unavailable). Used for fraud detection.

plainFields.name: cvv_result_code
plainFields.description: CVV verification result code from processor. M (match), N (no match), U (unavailable). Used for fraud detection.

plainFields.name: request_ip_address
plainFields.description: Customer's IP address when payment was submitted. Used for fraud detection and geographic verification.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when transaction was submitted to payment gateway.

plainFields.name: response_received_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when response was received from payment gateway. Null if no response (timeout).

plainFields.name: processing_duration_ms
plainFields.description: Time in milliseconds from submission to response received. Null if timeout. Used for performance monitoring.

models.name: shopping_mall_payment_methods
models.description: Secure storage of payment method information including tokenized card data, digital wallet references, and bank account details. Implements PCI-DSS compliance by storing only card tokens (never full card numbers), last 4 digits, card brand, and issuer information. Supports multiple payment method types: credit cards, debit cards, digital wallets, and bank transfers. Each payment method is tied to a customer for future reference and recurring payments.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Customer who owns this payment method. References {@link shopping_mall_customer.id}.

plainFields.name: payment_method_type
plainFields.description: Type of payment method: CREDIT_CARD, DEBIT_CARD, DIGITAL_WALLET (Apple Pay, Google Pay), BANK_TRANSFER. Determines which fields are populated.

plainFields.name: card_token
plainFields.description: Tokenized card data from payment gateway. PCI-compliant - replaces full card number. Never contains full 16-digit card number. Null for bank transfer methods.

plainFields.name: card_last_four
plainFields.description: Last 4 digits of card number for customer reference and verification (e.g., 4242). Used for displaying card in UI. Null for non-card methods.

plainFields.name: card_brand
plainFields.description: Card brand/network: VISA, MASTERCARD, AMEX, DISCOVER, DINERS, JCB, etc. Null for non-card methods. Used for displaying payment option.

plainFields.name: card_issuer
plainFields.description: Issuing bank or financial institution name (e.g., Bank of America, Chase). Optional for customer reference. Null if not available.

plainFields.name: card_expiration_month
plainFields.description: Card expiration month (1-12). Must be validated at each payment attempt. Null for non-card methods.

plainFields.name: card_expiration_year
plainFields.description: Card expiration year (e.g., 2025). Used to validate card hasn't expired. Null for non-card methods.

plainFields.name: cardholder_name
plainFields.description: Name on the card as it appears. Used for validation. Null for non-card methods.

plainFields.name: wallet_provider
plainFields.description: Digital wallet provider name: APPLE_PAY, GOOGLE_PAY, PAYPAL, etc. Null for card/bank methods.

plainFields.name: wallet_token
plainFields.description: Token received from digital wallet provider. Used for payment processing. Null for non-wallet methods.

plainFields.name: bank_account_token
plainFields.description: Tokenized bank account from gateway for bank transfers. PCI-compliant alternative to storing full account numbers. Null for non-bank methods.

plainFields.name: bank_account_last_four
plainFields.description: Last 4 digits of bank account number for customer reference. Null for non-bank methods.

plainFields.name: bank_routing_number_last_four
plainFields.description: Last 4 digits of routing number for bank transfers. For customer reference only. Null for non-bank methods.

plainFields.name: bank_name
plainFields.description: Bank name associated with bank transfer method. Null for non-bank methods.

plainFields.name: is_default
plainFields.description: Whether this is customer's default payment method. Used for checkout default selection. Only one method per customer should have is_default=true.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this payment method is currently active and available for use. Set to false if customer reports the method as invalid or compromised.

plainFields.name: failed_attempts
plainFields.description: Count of consecutive failed payment attempts using this method. Reset to 0 on successful payment. Incremented on failures. Helps identify problematic payment methods.

plainFields.name: last_used_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last successful payment using this method. Null if never successfully used. Used to identify stale/forgotten payment methods.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when payment method was added to customer's account.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when payment method details were last updated (e.g., card reactivated).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp. Set when customer removes payment method. Preserves payment history.

models.name: shopping_mall_payment_gateway_records
models.description: Records of all requests sent to and responses received from external payment gateway providers (e.g., Stripe, PayPal). Captures complete request/response payloads for troubleshooting, reconciliation, and audit purposes. Implements PCI compliance by not storing sensitive card data. Enables investigation of gateway issues and payment discrepancies. Each record represents one complete interaction with payment provider.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_payment_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to payment record for this gateway interaction. Links to {@link shopping_mall_payments.id}.

plainFields.name: gateway_provider
plainFields.description: Name of payment gateway provider: STRIPE, PAYPAL, SQUARE, AUTHORIZE_NET, etc. Identifies which processor this record is for.

plainFields.name: gateway_api_version
plainFields.description: API version of payment gateway used for this request (e.g., v1, v2). Helps track compatibility issues across gateway versions.

plainFields.name: request_id
plainFields.description: Unique request identifier generated by platform for request tracking. Used to correlate requests across systems.

plainFields.name: gateway_request_id
plainFields.description: Request ID assigned by payment gateway provider. May be null if request never reached gateway (network error).

plainFields.name: request_type
plainFields.description: Type of gateway request: AUTHORIZATION, CAPTURE, REFUND, VOID, INQUIRY, CHARGEBACK_INQUIRY. Determines request payload structure.

plainFields.name: request_payload
plainFields.description: Complete JSON request payload sent to payment gateway. IMPORTANT: Sensitive data (full card numbers, CVV) must be masked or not included. Format: sanitized JSON string.

plainFields.name: response_payload
plainFields.description: Complete JSON response payload received from payment gateway. Contains transaction result, error codes, authorization codes, processor references. Format: JSON string.

plainFields.name: response_status_code
plainFields.description: HTTP status code from gateway: 200 (success), 400 (bad request), 401 (unauthorized), 500 (server error). Helps identify gateway communication issues.

plainFields.name: response_received
plainFields.description: Whether response was successfully received from gateway. False indicates timeout or network failure. True means HTTP response received (may still indicate transaction decline).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when request was submitted to payment gateway.

plainFields.name: response_received_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when response was received from gateway. Null if request timed out or never reached gateway.

models.name: shopping_mall_payment_refunds
models.description: Records of refund requests and refund processing for customer orders. Tracks complete refund lifecycle from request submission through refund completion. Supports full refunds (entire order amount) and partial refunds (specific line items). Records refund approvals, denials, reversals, and completion status. Links to original payment for reversal operations. Enables tracking of refund status including estimated arrival date for customer communication.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_payment_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to original payment being refunded. Links to {@link shopping_mall_payments.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the order for which refund is being processed. Links to {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}.

foreignFields.name: requested_by_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Admin user who requested or approved the refund (if admin-initiated). References {@link shopping_mall_admin.id}. Null if customer-initiated refund.

plainFields.name: refund_amount
plainFields.description: Amount to be refunded in smallest currency unit. May be less than original payment amount for partial refunds.

plainFields.name: original_payment_amount
plainFields.description: Original payment amount for reference. Used to validate partial vs full refund.

plainFields.name: refund_status
plainFields.description: Current refund status: REQUESTED (awaiting approval), APPROVED (admin approved, awaiting processing), PROCESSING (refund submitted to gateway), COMPLETED (refund successfully processed), FAILED (refund attempt failed), REVERSED (refund was reversed/cancelled). Status progression: REQUESTED  APPROVED  PROCESSING  COMPLETED|FAILED.

plainFields.name: refund_reason
plainFields.description: Reason for refund: CUSTOMER_REQUEST, PRODUCT_DEFECTIVE, PRODUCT_NOT_AS_DESCRIBED, WRONG_ITEM_SHIPPED, DAMAGED_IN_TRANSIT, DUPLICATE_CHARGE, FRAUD, PAYMENT_ERROR, SELLER_FRAUD, ORDER_CANCELLED, RETURN_RECEIVED. Used for analytics and dispute handling.

plainFields.name: refund_method
plainFields.description: How refund will be issued: ORIGINAL_METHOD (back to original card/payment method), STORE_CREDIT (account credit), WALLET (digital wallet). ORIGINAL_METHOD is default if payment method supports reversal.

plainFields.name: is_full_refund
plainFields.description: Whether this is full refund of entire order (true) or partial refund of specific items (false). Affects eligibility checks and processing.

plainFields.name: affected_order_items
plainFields.description: For partial refunds, JSON array of order item IDs being refunded. Format: ["item_id_1", "item_id_2"]. Empty array for full refund. Used to calculate proportional tax and shipping.

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Admin or system notes about the refund request. May include reason clarifications, dispute details, or special handling instructions.

plainFields.name: gateway_refund_id
plainFields.description: Refund transaction ID assigned by payment gateway after processing. Used for tracking with payment provider and reconciliation.

plainFields.name: requested_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when refund was requested (by customer or admin).

plainFields.name: approved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when refund was approved by admin or automatically approved based on policy. Null until approval occurs.

plainFields.name: processing_started_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when refund processing began (submitted to payment gateway). Null until processing starts.

plainFields.name: completed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when refund was completed successfully. Funds have been returned to customer. Null until completion.

plainFields.name: estimated_completion_date
plainFields.description: Estimated date refund will appear in customer's account. Typically 3-7 business days for card refunds. Used for customer communication.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when refund record was created in system.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when refund record was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_payment_disputes
models.description: Records of payment disputes and chargebacks filed by customers or payment processors. Tracks dispute lifecycle from initial filing through investigation and final resolution. Supports multiple dispute types: chargeback (card processor initiated), payment complaint (customer initiated), fraud claim (security concern). Records all evidence, communications, and resolution details. Links to payment and includes admin investigation tracking for fair resolution of payment conflicts.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_payment_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to payment under dispute. Links to {@link shopping_mall_payments.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to order associated with disputed payment. Links to {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}.

foreignFields.name: investigating_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Admin assigned to investigate this dispute. References {@link shopping_mall_admin.id}. Null if dispute not yet assigned.

plainFields.name: dispute_type
plainFields.description: Type of dispute: CHARGEBACK (card processor), FRAUD_CLAIM (security concern), CUSTOMER_COMPLAINT (customer filed), PAYMENT_ERROR (system/gateway error). Determines investigation approach.

plainFields.name: dispute_status
plainFields.description: Current dispute status: OPEN (filed, awaiting investigation), INVESTIGATING (admin reviewing evidence), PENDING_RESOLUTION (awaiting final decision), RESOLVED (decision made - customer wins, merchant wins, or partial), APPEALING (one party appealed). Progression: OPEN  INVESTIGATING  PENDING_RESOLUTION  RESOLVED|APPEALING.

plainFields.name: dispute_amount
plainFields.description: Amount in dispute in smallest currency unit. May be less than full payment amount.

plainFields.name: customer_complaint
plainFields.description: Customer's description of the dispute issue. Null for chargebacks initiated by card processor. User complaint text for investigation.

plainFields.name: processor_chargeback_code
plainFields.description: Chargeback code from card processor (e.g., 4855, 1040, etc.). Null for non-chargeback disputes. Used to understand processor's reason category.

plainFields.name: processor_chargeback_reason
plainFields.description: Human-readable reason provided by processor for the chargeback. Examples: 'Fraudulent Transaction', 'Product Not Received', 'Unauthorized'. Null for non-chargeback disputes.

plainFields.name: investigation_notes
plainFields.description: Admin's investigation notes including findings, evidence reviewed, and reasoning. Updated as investigation progresses.

plainFields.name: resolution_decision
plainFields.description: Final resolution decision: CUSTOMER_WINS (refund issued), MERCHANT_WINS (dispute rejected), PARTIAL (compromise reached). Null until dispute resolved.

plainFields.name: resolution_reason
plainFields.description: Detailed explanation of resolution decision for both parties. Explains findings and reasoning for outcome.

plainFields.name: evidence_customer_provided
plainFields.description: JSON array of evidence URLs provided by customer or on their behalf. Examples: ["https://evidence1.pdf", "https://evidence2.jpg"]. Used for investigation.

plainFields.name: evidence_merchant_provided
plainFields.description: JSON array of evidence URLs provided by merchant/admin. Examples: delivery confirmation, customer communication, etc.

plainFields.name: is_appealed
plainFields.description: Whether dispute has been appealed by either party. If true, should create appeal workflow.

plainFields.name: filed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when dispute was filed (by customer, processor, or system).

plainFields.name: investigation_started_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when investigation began (admin assigned). Null until investigation starts.

plainFields.name: deadline_for_response
plainFields.description: Processor deadline for merchant to respond to chargeback (typically 7-10 days from filing). Critical for compliance with payment processor requirements.

plainFields.name: resolved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when dispute was resolved with final decision. Null until resolution occurs.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when dispute record was created in system.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when dispute record was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_payment_reconciliation
models.description: Records of batch payment reconciliation processes comparing platform transaction records against payment processor settlement reports. Tracks daily/weekly/monthly reconciliation cycles identifying discrepancies, missing transactions, and settlement confirmations. Enables identification and investigation of payment anomalies and ensures all payments are properly accounted for. Stores reconciliation results and any identified issues requiring manual intervention.

foreignFields.name: reconciliation_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Admin user responsible for initiating or managing this reconciliation. References {@link shopping_mall_admin.id}. Null if reconciliation is automated.

plainFields.name: reconciliation_type
plainFields.description: Type of reconciliation: DAILY (end of day), WEEKLY (weekly summary), MONTHLY (monthly close), ON_DEMAND (manual ad-hoc). Determines reconciliation scope and frequency.

plainFields.name: reconciliation_period_start
plainFields.description: Start timestamp for transactions included in reconciliation period. Inclusive.

plainFields.name: reconciliation_period_end
plainFields.description: End timestamp for transactions included in reconciliation period. Inclusive.

plainFields.name: reconciliation_status
plainFields.description: Status of reconciliation: PENDING (in progress), COMPLETED (successfully reconciled), DISCREPANCIES_FOUND (mismatches identified), REQUIRES_INVESTIGATION (manual review needed), RESOLVED (issues resolved). Indicates reconciliation outcome.

plainFields.name: platform_transaction_count
plainFields.description: Count of transactions recorded in platform during reconciliation period.

plainFields.name: platform_transaction_total
plainFields.description: Total value of all transactions recorded in platform during reconciliation period (smallest currency unit).

plainFields.name: processor_transaction_count
plainFields.description: Count of transactions reported by payment processor for reconciliation period.

plainFields.name: processor_transaction_total
plainFields.description: Total value of transactions reported by payment processor for reconciliation period (smallest currency unit).

plainFields.name: matched_transaction_count
plainFields.description: Count of transactions that matched between platform and processor records.

plainFields.name: unmatched_in_platform
plainFields.description: Count of transactions in platform records but missing from processor report. May indicate settlement lag or processing issues.

plainFields.name: unmatched_in_processor
plainFields.description: Count of transactions in processor report but missing from platform records. May indicate late transaction creation or system errors.

plainFields.name: total_discrepancy_amount
plainFields.description: Total dollar amount of discrepancies found (smallest currency unit). Absolute value of platform total vs processor total difference.

plainFields.name: discrepancy_details
plainFields.description: JSON structure describing identified discrepancies: {unmatched_transaction_ids: [...], amount_differences: [{transaction_id, platform_amount, processor_amount}]}. Null if no discrepancies.

plainFields.name: processor_gateway
plainFields.description: Name of payment processor being reconciled: STRIPE, PAYPAL, SQUARE, AUTHORIZE_NET, etc. Identifies which processor's report this reconciliation covers.

plainFields.name: processor_settlement_batch_id
plainFields.description: Settlement batch ID from processor for this reconciliation. Used to match against processor records. Null if not provided.

plainFields.name: investigation_required
plainFields.description: Whether this reconciliation requires admin investigation. Set to true if discrepancies exceed threshold or errors detected.

plainFields.name: investigation_notes
plainFields.description: Admin notes about investigation findings and actions taken to resolve discrepancies.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when reconciliation process was created/initiated.

plainFields.name: completed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when reconciliation process completed. Null if reconciliation still in progress.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when reconciliation record was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_shipments
models.description: Primary shipment records representing the physical fulfillment unit created from orders. Contains shipment-level information including carrier, tracking status, and timeline. Each shipment may contain multiple items from an order and represents a distinct fulfillment package sent to customer.

foreignFields.name: shopping_order_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the order being fulfilled. {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_shipping_carrier_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the carrier handling this shipment. {@link shopping_mall_shipping_carriers.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_shipping_address_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the validated delivery address for this shipment. {@link shopping_mall_shipping_addresses.id}

plainFields.name: shipment_number
plainFields.description: Human-readable shipment identifier in format SHIP-YYYYMMDD-XXXXXX for customer reference and tracking.

plainFields.name: tracking_number
plainFields.description: Carrier-provided tracking number for real-time package tracking. Unique identifier from shipping carrier.

plainFields.name: carrier_service_code
plainFields.description: Carrier-specific service code (e.g., 'FEDEX_GROUND', 'UPS_EXPRESS', 'DHL_INTERNATIONAL') identifying service level selected.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current shipment status from carrier: pending_pickup, picked_up, in_transit, out_for_delivery, delivered, exception, returned_to_sender. Reflects carrier-reported status.

plainFields.name: weight_kg
plainFields.description: Total weight of shipment in kilograms including all items and packaging. Used for shipping cost calculation and carrier requirements.

plainFields.name: estimated_delivery_date
plainFields.description: Expected delivery date and time provided by carrier based on service level. May be updated as shipment progresses.

plainFields.name: actual_delivery_date
plainFields.description: Actual date and time when delivery was confirmed by carrier. Null until delivery is confirmed.

plainFields.name: signature_required
plainFields.description: Whether signature is required upon delivery for added security and proof of delivery.

plainFields.name: insurance_amount
plainFields.description: Insurance coverage amount in order currency for high-value shipments. Null if no insurance purchased.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when shipment record was created in system (when shipped from warehouse).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last update to shipment status or information.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp if shipment record is archived or voided. Null for active shipments.

models.name: shopping_mall_shipment_items
models.description: Individual items contained within a shipment. Represents line-items that are part of a specific shipment, linking SKU/inventory to the shipment. Each item references an order item and its corresponding inventory. Enables per-item tracking and management within shipment.

foreignFields.name: shopping_shipment_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the parent shipment containing this item. {@link shopping_mall_shipments.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_order_item_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the order line item being shipped. {@link shopping_mall_order_items.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_inventory_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the SKU inventory record for this item. {@link shopping_mall_inventory_skus.id}

plainFields.name: quantity
plainFields.description: Quantity of this SKU included in the shipment. May be partial if order item split across multiple shipments.

plainFields.name: item_status
plainFields.description: Status of this specific item within shipment: pending, packed, scanned, in_transit, out_for_delivery, delivered, damaged, missing.

plainFields.name: tracking_status
plainFields.description: Item-level tracking status synchronized from shipment tracking. May differ from shipment status if item damaged/missing.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when shipment item record was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last update to item status or information.

models.name: shopping_mall_shipment_tracking
models.description: Immutable audit trail of all tracking events and status updates throughout shipment lifecycle. Records every status change reported by carrier including timestamps, locations, and event details. Enables complete historical tracking and troubleshooting.

foreignFields.name: shopping_shipment_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the shipment this tracking event belongs to. {@link shopping_mall_shipments.id}

plainFields.name: event_timestamp
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the tracking event occurred according to carrier (ISO 8601 format UTC timezone).

plainFields.name: event_code
plainFields.description: Carrier-specific event code (e.g., 'PKG_DELIVERED', 'IN_TRANSIT', 'DELIVERY_ATTEMPTED'). Enables carrier-agnostic event handling.

plainFields.name: event_status
plainFields.description: Status name from event: pending_pickup, picked_up, in_transit, out_for_delivery, delivered, exception, returned. Human-readable status.

plainFields.name: event_description
plainFields.description: Detailed description of the tracking event from carrier (e.g., 'Package delivered to customer', 'Delivery attempted - customer not home').

plainFields.name: location_city
plainFields.description: City or facility location where event occurred. Null if location unavailable from carrier.

plainFields.name: location_state
plainFields.description: State or province of event location. Null if location unavailable.

plainFields.name: location_country
plainFields.description: Country of event location. Null if location unavailable.

plainFields.name: exception_code
plainFields.description: Carrier exception code if event indicates problem (e.g., 'DELIVERY_FAILED', 'WEATHER_DELAY'). Null if no exception.

plainFields.name: exception_description
plainFields.description: Detailed description of exception or problem. Null if no exception. Helps troubleshoot delivery issues.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when tracking record was received and stored in system (server time).

models.name: shopping_mall_shipping_addresses
models.description: Validated delivery addresses for shipments, captured at time of shipment creation for historical accuracy. Denormalizes customer address data to preserve exact delivery location even if customer address changes later. Enables address history tracking and dispute resolution.

plainFields.name: recipient_name
plainFields.description: Full name of package recipient as provided in shipment order.

plainFields.name: phone_number

plainFields.name: street_address

plainFields.name: special_instructions

plainFields.name: created_at

models.name: shopping_mall_delivery_confirmations
models.description: Final delivery confirmation records representing successful package receipt by customer. Creates immutable record of delivery completion for order fulfillment and dispute resolution.

foreignFields.name: shopping_shipment_id

plainFields.name: confirmation_timestamp

plainFields.name: delivered_to
plainFields.description: Name or description of person/entity that received the package (e.g., 'John Doe', 'Signature on file', 'Left at door').

plainFields.name: delivery_location
plainFields.description: Specific location where package was left or delivered (e.g., 'Front porch', 'Back door', 'Delivery box', 'Office entrance').

plainFields.name: signature_image_url
plainFields.description: URL/URI to signature image proof of delivery if signature was required. Null if no signature collected.

plainFields.name: delivery_photo_url
plainFields.description: URL/URI to photo taken at delivery for verification purposes. Null if no photo captured.

plainFields.name: weather_conditions
plainFields.description: Weather conditions reported at delivery time (e.g., 'Clear', 'Rainy'). Optional detail from carrier.

plainFields.name: temperature_fahrenheit
plainFields.description: Temperature in Fahrenheit at delivery time for temperature-sensitive items tracking. Null if not applicable.

plainFields.name: carrier_confirmation_code
plainFields.description: Carrier's confirmation code for this delivery event. Used for dispute resolution and verification.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when delivery confirmation record was created in system.

models.name: shopping_mall_return_shipments
models.description: Records for return shipments handling reverse logistics when customers return ordered items. Linked to original shipments for complete order return workflow.

foreignFields.name: shopping_shipment_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the original forward shipment being returned. {@link shopping_mall_shipments.id}

foreignFields.name: shopping_shipping_carrier_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the carrier handling the return shipment (may differ from forward shipment). {@link shopping_mall_shipping_carriers.id}

plainFields.name: return_authorization_number
plainFields.description: Return authorization (RMA) number issued to customer for return shipment identification and tracking.

plainFields.name: return_reason
plainFields.description: Reason for return from customer (e.g., 'defective', 'not_as_described', 'wrong_item', 'changed_mind').

plainFields.name: return_tracking_number
plainFields.description: Carrier-provided tracking number for the return shipment. Enables tracking of items returning to seller.

plainFields.name: return_status
plainFields.description: Status of return shipment: pending, return_label_issued, in_transit, received_by_seller, inspected, completed, cancelled.

plainFields.name: return_label_url
plainFields.description: URL to downloadable return shipping label PDF for customer to print. Null until label is generated.

plainFields.name: return_label_expiry_date
plainFields.description: Deadline by which customer must ship return using provided label. After this date label may be invalid.

plainFields.name: shipment_sent_date
plainFields.description: Date when customer shipped the return package (when tracking picked up by carrier). Null until shipped.

plainFields.name: return_received_date
plainFields.description: Date when seller received and recorded receipt of returned package. Null until received.

plainFields.name: inspection_notes
plainFields.description: Notes from seller's inspection of returned item (condition, damages, completeness check). Null until inspected.

plainFields.name: inspection_status
plainFields.description: Result of inspection: pending_inspection, accepted, partial_damage, condition_issue, missing_parts, not_as_returned.

plainFields.name: prepaid_return_shipping
plainFields.description: Whether return shipping was prepaid by platform/seller (true) or customer responsible (false).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when return shipment record was created (when return authorized).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last update to return shipment status or information.

models.name: shopping_mall_shipping_carriers
models.description: Carrier master data containing information about shipping service providers (USPS, FedEx, UPS, DHL, etc.). Stores carrier integration details, service codes, supported countries, and API configuration for real-time tracking integration. Enables multi-carrier support and carrier selection during checkout.

plainFields.name: carrier_code
plainFields.description: Unique carrier code identifier (e.g., 'USPS', 'FEDEX', 'UPS', 'DHL'). Used internally for carrier selection.

plainFields.name: carrier_name
plainFields.description: Full human-readable name of carrier for customer display (e.g., 'United States Postal Service', 'FedEx Ground').

plainFields.name: carrier_logo_url
plainFields.description: URL to carrier logo image for customer-facing interfaces. Used in order tracking displays.

plainFields.name: api_key
plainFields.description: Carrier API key for authentication with carrier tracking API. Encrypted at rest for security.

plainFields.name: api_secret
plainFields.description: Carrier API secret/password for authentication. Encrypted at rest and never exposed in logs.

plainFields.name: api_endpoint
plainFields.description: Base URL for carrier's API endpoint used for tracking lookups and shipping label generation.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this carrier integration is currently active and available for use in shipment creation.

plainFields.name: supports_international
plainFields.description: Whether carrier supports international shipping to multiple countries.

plainFields.name: supported_countries
plainFields.description: Comma-separated list of ISO country codes this carrier supports (e.g., 'US,CA,MX'). Null if international support limited.

plainFields.name: tracking_url_template
plainFields.description: URL template for customer tracking page (e.g., 'https://tracking.carrier.com/track?number={tracking_number}'). Use {tracking_number} as placeholder.

plainFields.name: max_package_weight_kg
plainFields.description: Maximum package weight limit in kilograms this carrier will accept. Null if no limit.

plainFields.name: max_package_length_cm
plainFields.description: Maximum package length in centimeters. Combined with width/height used for dimension limits.

plainFields.name: max_package_width_cm
